name: Уур амьсгалын өөрчлөлт ба түүний асуудлууд
author: Ус цаг уур орчны судалгаа, мэдээллийн хүрээлэн
introduction_mn:
Энэхүү хурлыг Уур амьсгалын өөрчлөлт, түүний үр дагаврыг ойлгох түвшинг
нэмэгдүүлэх, энэ үйл хэрэгт бүх нийтээр хүч чармайлт зүтгэл гарган
ажиллах, анхаарал хандуулах, нөлөөллийг сааруулах, зөөлрүүлэх,
дасан зохицох арга замыг судлах зайлшгүй шаардлагын үүднээс уг
судалгааг тодорхой бүс нутгийн түвшинд хамтын хүчээр гүйцэтгэх
нь чухал гэж үзээд  2002 оноос хойш тодорхой сэдвийн дор хийж эхэлсэн ба 2002-2013 оны хооронд жил бүр хийгдэж байгаад 2013 оноос 2 жил тутамд 1 удаа хийгдэж байгаа. Монгол орны бүх аймгууд, Улаанбаатар хотын ус, цаг уур, орчны чиглэлээр судлгаа хийгдэг эрдэмтдийн бүтээлээ хэлэлцүүлдэг хамгийн том хурал юм.

name: The 11th International Conference on Multimedia Information Technology and Applications
author: Korean Multimedia Society
introduction_mn: Өмнөд Солонгос Мультимедиа нийгэмлэг (http://www.kmms.or.kr/), тэргүүлэгч БНСУ-ын их дээд сургууль, Узбекстаны Ташкент Улсын Техникийн их сургуулийн хамгийн нэр хүндтэй эрдэм шинжилгээний нийгэмлэгүүд хамтран MITA2015  хурлыг зохион байгуулж байна. Энэ нь мультимедиа мэдээлэл, хэрэглээний төрөл бүрийн асуудлаарх олон улсын форум болно. Энэ нь өмнө нь MITA2014 (Хонг Конг, 2014), MITA2013 (Индонез, 2013) болон MITA2012 (Хятад, 2012) зэрэг зохион байгуулж амжилттай олон улсын хурал цуврал дараагийн үйл явдал юм.
introduction_en: MITA2015 is organized by one of the most reputable research societies in South Korea, Korea Multimedia Society (http://www.kmms.or.kr/), leading Korean universities and Tashkent State Technical University in Uzbekistan. It provides an international forum for the presentation and showcase of recent advances on various aspects of multimedia information and applications. It is the next event in a series of highly successful international conferences previously held as MITA2014 (Hong Kong, 2014), MITA2013 (Indonesia, 2013) and MITA2012 (China, 2012).

name: The 135th symposium of the pharmaceutical society of Japan
author: The Pharmaceutical Society of Japan
introduction_mn: The Pharmaceutical Society of Japan (PSJ) must be more appropriately called as The Pharmaceutical Sciences Society of Japan. Since her inauguration in 1880, PSJ has grown to make great contributions to basic and applied pharmaceutical sciences and now has as many as 20,000 research-minded individual members. The research-oriented activities of PSJ has been inherited from legendary accomplishments by world-leading pharmaceutical pioneers throughout her 125 years history.

introduction_en: The conference aims to bring together leading academic scientists, researchers and research scholars to share knowledge, experiences and research results about all aspects of Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development and to offer an excellent networking opportunity for academics, researchers and practitioners working, whether at micro or macro levels and to provide the premier interdisciplinary and multidisciplinary discussions for researchers, practitioners and educators on the most recent trends, and concerns, practical challenges encountered and the solutions adopted in this commercially important field.

name: Хүнсний аюулгүй байдлын үндэсний лавлагаа лабораторийн эрдэм шинжилгээний бага хурал
author: Хүнсний аюулгүй байдлын үндэсний лавлагаа лаборатори
introduction_mn:
Жил бүр уламжлал болон зохион байгуулагддаг Хүнсний аюулгүй байдлын үндэсний лавлагаа лабораторийн “Эрдэм шинжилгээний бага хурал” жил бүр зохион байгуулагддаг.
МХЕГ, Эм судлалын хүрээлэн, ХАБҮЛЛ хамтран зохион байгуулсан уг хуралд хяналтын итгэмжлэгдсэн сүлжээ лабораторийн эрхлэгчид, эрдэм шинжилгээний байгууллага, их дээд сургуулийн эрдэмтэн багш судлаач нар оролцдог. Эмийн био бэлдмэл, уламжлалт эм, эмнэлгийн хэрэгслийн технологи, чанар, аюулгүй байдлын тандалт судлагаа шинжилгээ, тулгамдсан асуудлынхаа талаар хөндөн хэлэлцдэг.

introduction_en: Monos Group of Company has laid its foundation on 1990 as a first private pharmaceutical th and beauty product manufacturer in Mongolia. Today, marking its 25 year anniversary, the Company has grownfrom a small private company to a one of the biggest conglomerates with 15 subsidiary companies and 1200 full time staff. We bring the best of pharmaceutical and bioengineering products, cosmetics, food and health products through our manufacturing and trading line. As a leading Company in health and service sector, we will always strive to keep our commitment to our consumers by providing the best service, value and quality.

introduction_en: State of the Forestry education and research in Mongolia

name: Expert Workshop “Restoration and Adaptation of Mountain Forests in Central and Northeast Asia”
author: IUFRO
introduction_mn: Энэхүү хурлын үндсэн зорилго нь Төв болон Зүүн Хойд Азийн орнуудын ойн экологийн асуудлуудын хөндөн хэлэлцэх бөгөөд ялангуяа өндөр уулын ойн экосистем, ойн хэвшинж, ойн менежментийн аргууд, байгалийн хүний хүчин зүйлийн ойн экосистемд үзүүлж буй нөлөөг хэлэлцэхэд оршино
introduction_en: The purpose of the seminar is an open table discussion regarding of freely obtainable exchange in information on forest ecology in Central and North-East Asia, with the emphasis on mountain forests. Special focus will be in the recreation of the major forest types, methods of forest management activities and the effects of natural and anthropogenic events on different types of the forest

name: International Workshop on Long-term Ecological  Research and Sustainable Forest Management  in Northeast Asia
author: IUFRO Working Group 1.01.13 Long term Research on Forest Ecosystem Management in Northeast Asia
introduction_mn: Энэхүү хурлын үндсэн зорилго нь: ойн нөхөн сэргээлт, ойн тогтвортой менежментийн хууль, эрхзүйн асуудлууд, стратеги, ойн биологийн олон янз байдал, түүний хамгаалал, уур амьсгалын өөрчлөлт, түүнд дасан зохицох, ойн экосистемийн урт хугацааны мониторинг судалгаа, түүний төлвийн талаар хэлэлцэн цаашдын шаардлагатай арга хэмжээг бүс нутгийн хэмжээнд тодорхойлоход оршино
introduction_en:
Forests cover approximately 30% of the Earth’s land surface and provide critical ecosystem goods and services, including food, fodder, water, shelter, nutrient cycling, and cultural and recreational value. Forests also store carbon, provide habitat for a wide range of species and help alleviate land degradation and desertification. Forests are composed with biologically diverse systems, however, forests are increasingly threatened as a result of deforestation, fragmentation, climate change and other stressors that can be linked to human activities. Climate change, in particular, is expected to impact on forest biodiversity and the ability of forests to provide soil and water protection, habitat for species and other ecosystem services. Forest ecosystems identified as being particularly vulnerable to the impacts of climate change (Rio Conventions, 2010). Climate change and forests are intrinsically linked: climate change is a threat to forests, and protecting forests from conversion and degradation helps mitigate the impacts of climate change. Adaptation strategies are needed to minimize potential negative impacts on the forest ecosystem, from national to regional scales. The complexity of natural and human systems is however a formidable barrier to quantifying climate change impacts and vulnerabilities.
The key objectives of the workshop will include, but not limit to, the following areas: restoration on degraded forests, national strategy and policy on sustainable forest management, biodiversity conservation, mitigation and adaptation to climate change, long-term ecological research etc.
Participants are expected from academia, research institutes, governmental agencies, NGOs and International organizations. During the workshop, participants from concerned countries or organizations will also discuss follow-up activities of the workshop.

name: Asia-Pacific Forestry Week 2016. “Forest Landscape Restoration and Land Degradation Neutrality in Asia”
author: IUFRO working Party 1.01.13
introduction_mn: Ази тивийн хэмжээнд ойн хомсдол, ойн доройтол, хөрсний эвдрэл зэрэг олон хэлбэрийн байгалийн гамшиг их хэмжээний газар нутгийг хамраад байна. Түүний дотор нийт нутгийн хуурай, гандуу бүс нутгийн хэмжээнд цөлжилт, газрын доройтол тулгамдсан асуудал болоод байна.
introduction_en: Deforestation, forest degradation and land degradation manifest themselves in many different forms across the vast region of Asia. Out of a total land area of 4.3 billion ha, Asia contains some 1.7 billion ha of arid, semi-arid and dry sub-humid land including deforested land areas. There are expanding deserts in China and Mongolia, and land degradation is in severe level in DPR of Korea in particular. Those deforestation, forest degradation and land degradation have also affected negatively to human livelihood. Forest Landscape Restoration (FLR) approach has pursued ecological integrity in forest/land restoration as well as human well-being enhancement at the same time. It includes not only tree planting, managing natural regeneration and improving land management, but also encouraging the active stakeholders’ engagement in sustainable agriculture, agroforestry, protecting wildlife reserves, watershed protection etc., which is more holistic approach in restoring environment and human livelihood. This Side Event will share the experiences and knowledge on this approach in Asia and discuss further cooperative ways. The presenters will be the representatives from IUFRO, the Ministry of Land Environment Protection (MoLEP) of the DPR of Korea, National University of Mongolia, Vietnam Academy of Forest Science, Dry Zone Greening Department in Myanmar. This Side Event is opened to any audience who is interested and would like to learn and discuss on combating land degradation and forest landscape restoration approach in Asia.

author: International Conference for Nuclear Cooperation in Asia
introduction_en: The 1st International Conference for Nuclear Cooperation in Asia (ICNCA) was held by the Atomic Energy Commission in March 1990 to promote cooperation in the field of nuclear energy with neighboring Asian countries more efficiently. Since then, the Atomic Energy Commission of Japan has held many ICNCAs where the ministers in charge of development and utilization of nuclear energy exchanged frank views on how to proceed with regional cooperation, and has carried out practical cooperation on specified subjects as well. At the 10th International Conference for Nuclear Cooperation in Asia held in March 1999, it was agreed to move to a new framework, "Forum for Nuclear Cooperation in Asia" (including Coordinator and Project Leader System) with a view and information to shifting to more effective and organized cooperation activities. Under this framework, view and information exchanges are made on the following fields: (1) Radiation Utilization Development (Industrial Utilization/Environmental Utilization, and Healthcare Utilization), (2) Research Reactor Utilization Development, (3) Nuclear Safety Strengthening, and (4) Nuclear Infrastructure Strengthening.

name: International Conference on Research Reactors
author: International Atomic Energy Agency
introduction_en:
The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has promoted and fostered the exchange of scientific and technical information on research reactors for many years. An important mechanism for this exchange is the organization of periodic meetings, seminars, symposia and conferences. Since 2003 the IAEA has been organizing major international conferences on topics of interest to the research reactor community every four years. The last such event was the International Conference on Research Reactors: Safe Management and Effective Utilization held in Rabat, Morocco, in November 2011.

A number of significant issues still being faced by the research reactor community are primarily related to operation, maintenance, utilization, safety, security, ageing management, decommissioning, spent fuel and waste management. More recent challenges have to do with initiatives to support new research reactor projects (including national infrastructure development), safety reassessment of facilities following the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant in March 2011, and fresh fuel supply. Additional challenges, such as securing isotope production, competence management and succession planning, strategic planning and the sustainability of research reactor programmes, are also receiving greater attention. In view of the above, a new international conference is being convened in 2015 to discuss these issues, report on relevant progress and plans, exchange information, and foster cooperation among the research reactor community.

name: SID 2015
author: Society for Information Display
introduction_en:
Society for Information Display is comprised of the top scientists, engineers, corporate researchers, and business people of the display industry, valued at over US$100B annually. SID was formed in 1962 to promulgate display technology, and that work continues today, publishing a monthly Journal of SID, Information Display magazine, and our annual Digest of Technical Papers, which is presented at our annual spring Display Week Symposium and Exhibition. These publications are available online without additional charge for members. 

The annual Display Week Exhibition is the best event for the sales and marketing of displays and related products to the North American market, because it attracts the top companies and senior business and technical staff who make product management and purchasing decisions, shaping the industry.  The core part of Display Week, SID's Symposium, began in 1963 and has about 70 technical events, comprised of 400 oral and poster presentations, as well as associated events: Business Conference, Investors Conference, Sunday Short Courses, Monday Technical Seminars, Industry Awards Lunch, Market Focus Conferences, Exhibitors' Forum, and the I-Zone of peer-reviewed prototypes.  SID has chapters located throughout the world; members are free to choose which chapter they wish to belong to, and many chapters webcast their technical meetings, some of which are available to members as recordings free of charge.  

SID also promotes the SID-Wiley book series on display technology, and other conferences including LatinDisplay in Brazil, EuroDisplay in Europe, International Display Workshops in Japan, and Asia Display.  Students are supported with deeply discounted memberships, and travel grants for some with the best papers.  To train engineers, obtain fresh market perspectives for businesspeople, and for cutting-edge information on tomorrows displays, there's no place like SID!  

The Society for Information Display
When you join the Society for Information Display, you are joining the international display community — and a local one. From Osaka to Eindhoven, you will find colleagues passionately involved in display and display-system design, integration, marketing, display standards, manufacturing, human factors, applications, and R&D. 

Each of these display professionals is a member of the chapter of his or her choice. The chapters have periodic meetings, and some run conferences and trade shows that have national — even international — appeal. The chapters interact both directly and through the central SID International Office, and chapter meetings often feature speakers with international reputations. SID’s largest international gathering is the annual SID Symposium, Seminar, and Exposition, which attracts thousands of attendees, speakers, and exhibitors from around the world. Here, the members of the international display community come together face to face, share technical information, develop business opportunities, and make new friends — just as we have done since 1962. We invite you to join us.

author: Mongolian Young Researcher's Association of Technology and Innovation
introduction_mn:
Монголын Залуу Эрдэмтдийн Холбооноос ХҮРЭЛТОГООТ эрдэм шинжилгээний бага хурлыг Боловсрол Шинжлэх Ухааны Яамны дэмжлэгтэйгээр Шинжлэх Ухааны Академи, Шинжлэх Ухаан Технологийн Сан, Их дээд сургууль, эрдэм шинжилгээний байгууллагуудтай хамтран зохион байгуулдаг. Энэхүү ЭШБХ-ыг зохион байгуулах журам нь БСШУ-ны сайдын 2005 оны 09-р сарын 30-ны өдрийн 305 дугаар тушаалаар батлагджээ.

Уг хурал нь залуу судлаач,эрдэмтэд, багш нар эрдэм шинжилгээнийхээ ажлын үр дүнг харилцан мэдээлэх,шүүн хэлэлцүүлэх,шинжлэх ухаан технологийн шинэлэг үр дүн, ололт амжилтаас харилцан суралцах,онолын маргаан явуулах,дотоод гадаадын нэрт эрдэмтдийн ажлын туршлага арга барилаас суралцах зэрэг үйл ажиллагааг зохион байгуулах хэлбэрээр залуу  судлаачдын эрдэм шинжилгээний ажлын арга зүйн мэдлэг,түвшинг дээшлүүлэхэд манай засгийн газраас авч хэрэгжүүлж буй нийгэм, эдийн засгийн хөгжлийн хувьд чухал ач холбогдолтой арга хэмжээ юм.

name: International Geographical Congress
author: International Geographical Union
introduction_en:
The International Geographical Union (IGU) is an international international, non-governmental, professional organization devoted to the development of the discipline of Geography.

The purposes of the IGU are primarily to promote Geography through initiating and coordinating geographical research and teaching in all countries of the world.  Its work is conducted through the instruments of its National Committees, Commissions and Task Forces.

The IGU hosts the International Geographical Congress every four years and also promotes regional conferences and other meetings that further of the objectives of the Union.  The IGU also facilitates the participation of geographers in the global community of scientists through its formal affiliation as a Member Union within both the International Council for Science (ICSU) and the International Social Science Council (ISSC).

name: Международная молодежная научно-практическая конференция (Россия-Монголия)
author: Россия
introduction_mn:
Введение: В экономике Монголии большое значение имеет скотоводство в том числе верблюдоводство. Двугорбые домашные верблюды хорошо приспособлены в климатических условиях  пустынной зоны и дают высококачественные продукты.
Дикие двугорбые верблюды-хавтгай описанные впервые русским путешественником Прежевальским обитают Заалтайской гоби. 
Мы в данной работе сообщаем результаты молекулярно-генетического исследования этих двух видов р. Camelus в Монголии.

author: IMAPS
introduction_en: The International Symposium on Microelectronics is organized by IMAPS on an annual basis (every Fall) and it is the signature event of the Society. Recent symposia feature more than 25-30 sessions with 175 technical speakers publishing peer-reviewed proceedings papers. The meeting began in 1967 under the organization of ISHM, which merged with IEPS in 1996 to form IMAPS. The Technical Committee of the Society recruits original papers that present progress on technologies throughout the entire microelectronics/packaging supply chain.

name: GSDI 15 World Conference
author: The Global Spatial Data Infrastructure Association
introduction_en:
The Global Spatial Data Infrastructure (GSDI) Association was formed in 2004 as an inclusive networking organization of academic and research institutions, government agencies, commercial geomatics firms, national and regional GI associations and individuals (geo professionals and students) from around the world.

The purpose of the Association is to promote international cooperation and collaboration in support of local, national and international spatial data infrastructure (SDI) research and implementations that will allow nations to better address social, economic, and environmental issues of pressing importance, including sustainable development.

    GSDI today has 38 Organisational Members from 20 countries and over 400 individual members from 55 countries with a high concentration in developing nations.
    GSDI has Special Consultative status with UN ECOSOC and supports the UN Global Geospatial Information Management (UN UN GGIM) initiative.
    GSDI promotes the Open Data Principles of GEO/GEOSS.

GSDI is involved in SDI capacity building activities in several ways, including:

    the GSDI Small Grants Program (in cooperation with URISA’s GISCorps volunteers)
    SDI and geomatics training opportunities offered by our institutional members, and
    SDI-focused workshops and seminars offered by members globally.

Since 1996, the Association has conducted GSDI World Conferences around the globe, offering significant networking opportunities and offering the opportunity for SDI researchers and SDI implementors to present their latest work, challenges and solutions. GSDI 15 will be held in Taipei, Taiwan, 28 November to 2 December 2016. See more about the GSDI World Conferences here.

GSDI have liasons and Memorandums of Understanding with several global organisations, including:

    Joint Board of Geospatial Information Societies (JBGIS)
    International Cartographic Association (ICA)
    International Federation of Surveyors (FIG)
    International Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing (ISPRS)
    International Society for Digital Earth (ISDE)
    Centre for Disaster Management and Public Safety (CDMPS - Univ. of Melbourne)
the GSDI 15 World Conference (GSDI 15) will be held in Taipei, Taiwan (Rep. of China), from 29 November to 2 December 2016 at the Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center. The theme of GSDI 15 is “Spatial Enablement in the Smart Homeland”. Workshop opportunities will be offered on 28 November and during the conference itself.

The GSDI World Conference has built a reputation for excellence in content and relocates across the globe to offer geospatial specialists in all parts of the world opportunities to better exchange ideas and learn from global peers in building spatial data infrastructure (SDI).

GSDI 15 offers numerous opportunities for oral presentations, posters and refereed publications. We invite presentations covering the full range of practice, development and research experiences that advance the practice and theory of spatially enabling citizens, government, and industry.

name: X. International Turkic Culture, Art and Protection of Cultural Heritage Symposium/Art Activity
Natural Resources and Sustainable Development in Mongolian Plateau
author: Монгол-ШУА, Хятад-ШУА, ОХУ-ШУА
introduction_en:
Since 2005 the Mongolian Plateau science conference has served a venue for researchers from Mongolia, China, and Russia to share recent scientific advances in promoting sustainable development and natural resource management in the region. This 11th conference provides a platform to continue scientific efforts to inform policies and decision-making at the Mongolian Plateau.
The 2016 conference highlights scientific contribution to understanding the causes and consequences of climate change in social-ecological systems in Mongolian plateau and its surrounding regions, and emerging solutions to climate-related hazards and socio-economic and natural resource degradation problems. Combining a variety of traditional and innovative interactive formats, this meeting encourages dialogue among diverse disciplines and across cultural, linguistic and national boundaries to think creatively about the future of Mongolian plateau, its social-ecological systems and the policies and practices needed to sustain them.
The organizers warmly welcome researchers from all disciplines related to the sustainable future of social-ecological systems at the Mongolian plateau. We encourage participation of experienced scientists, young researchers as well as representatives of government agencies, donors, and NGOs who are interested in obtaining the most up-to-date scientific information relating the Mongolian Plateau and surrounding regions.

Expected outcomes of the conference include increased interdisciplinary dialogue between scientists working on the thematic areas related to the Mongolian Plateau, synthesis of latest natural and social science results, identification of original solutions to challenges of sustainable development and resource management in the region.Young researchers are encouraged. Essentially, the organizers would like to see new ideas and proposals created by the conference for joint studies and cross-cultural research between scientists from different countries that inform sustainable development policies and decision-making in the region.

name: Second workshop on the application pilot projects for APSCO data sharing service playform
author: Asia-Pacific Space Cooperation Organization
introduction_en:
The Second Workshop on the Application Pilot Projects for APSCO Data Sharing Service Platform was held at Bangkok, Thailand from 15 to 17 November 2016. 35 delegates from Member States and APSCO Secretariat participated in the workshop. During the workshop, the research result of two APSCO Application Pilot Project for APSCO Data Sharing Service Platform (DSSP) were shared, the techniques and methods used in the project were introduced. Besides, 12 presentations from Member States were presented by the participants covering topics on various applications of remote sensing technology, including drought monitoring, rice monitoring, wildfires monitoring, data processing, data platform and etc. All delegates were very actively involved in the discussion on the presentation. Information and knowledge were shared in this workshop.
After the workshop, the Final Review Meeting on this project was held back to back. The PMB Members reviewed the final report of the 2 application pilot project, and the PMB concluded that the projects were successfully implemented and output of the project is very useful. The project can be considered   accomplished after the final report updated according to the comments by PMB. And the updated final report will be shared with all Member States.

introduction_en:
Fall Meeting is the largest worldwide conference in the geophysical sciences, attracting more than 24,000 Earth and space scientists, educators, students, and other leaders. Now in its 49th year, Fall Meeting brings together the entire Earth and space science community from across the globe for discussions of emerging trends and the latest research. The technical program includes presentations on new and cutting-edge science, much of which has not yet been published, meaning you’ll return to work with knowledge you can’t get anywhere else.

Fall Meeting offers a unique mix of more than 20,000 oral and poster presentations, a broad range of keynote sessions, various types of formal and informal networking and career advancement opportunities, and an exhibit hall packed with hundreds of exhibitors showcasing new and relevant research tools and services that meet the professional needs of our attendees’ year after year.

author: Hebrew University of Jerusalem

name: Thunder from the steppes
author: UC Berkely
introduction_en: This is envisioned as at once a conference that speaks to the study of a globalized world and to the specificity of identity politics. The Mongol Empire orients history between Asia and Europe, ancient and modern, rural and urban, settled and nomadic, scientific and faith-based, and soteriological and aristocratic worlds. Even so, its study largely has been ignored in Western academia, where history departments that support its course offerings, let alone advanced research, are few and far between. Should one seek causes for this tremendous lacuna, one need look no further than to Mongolia itself where during the country’s communist era intellectuals were led by ideological reasons grounded in Marxism and modernity to write off their own history as irrelevant. This conference invites new research on the Mongol empire in an effort to re-situate and re-evaluate the study and the significance of the Mongol empire in a global context.

name: European Geosciences Union
author: European Geophysical Society (EGS) and the European Union of Geosciences (EUG)
introduction_mn: 2002 оны 9 сараас Европын геофизикийн холбоо болон Европын Гео шинжлэх ухааны холбоо ннэгдэн, Европын Геошинжлэх ухааны холбоо болон үйл ажиллагаагаа явуулж эхэлсэн. Нийт 12500 гишүүдтэй. 17 салбар сэтгүүлтэй. Хурлууд нь маш өргөн хүрээтэйгээр вулканологи, цаг уур, хайгуул, эрчим хүч гэх мэтийн олон тооны  асуудлуудыг авч хэлэлцдэг юм.
introduction_en:
EGU, the European Geosciences Union, is Europe’s premier geosciences union, dedicated to the pursuit of excellence in the Earth, planetary, and space sciences for the benefit of humanity, worldwide. It was established in September 2002 as a merger of the European Geophysical Society (EGS) and the European Union of Geosciences (EUG), and has headquarters in Munich, Germany.

It is a non-profit international union of scientists with over 12,500 members from all over the world. Membership is open to individuals who are professionally engaged in or associated with geosciences and planetary and space sciences and related studies, including students and retired seniors.

The EGU has a current portfolio of 17 diverse scientific journals, which use an innovative open access format, and organises a number of topical meetings, and education and outreach activities. Its annual General Assembly is the largest and most prominent European geosciences event, attracting over 11,000 scientists from all over the world. The meeting’s sessions cover a wide range of topics, including volcanology, planetary exploration, the Earth’s internal structure and atmosphere, climate, as well as energy and resources.

name: 2nd International Symposium on Frontiers in Materials Science
author: Waseda University, Tokyo, Japan
introduction_en:
It is our great pleasure to announce the 2nd International Symposium on Frontiers in Materials Science (FMS) to be held in Waseda University at downtown Tokyo, Japan, November 19-21 in 2015. This symposium, which continues the successful 1st meeting in Hanoi, Vietnam in 2013, will be organized every two years. FMS 2015 will cover a wide range of research directions in basic and applied materials science. 

In particular, the following topics will be addressed: 
Magnetism and Nano-structured Magnetic Materials
Advanced Photonic Materials
Theoretical and Computational Materials Science
Microfluidics, Colloid and Polymers
Nano-scale Materials Characterization

Selected papers will be peer-reviewed for a Special Topic Issue of Journal of Applied Physics (AIP Publishing). Please visit Publication page for details.

author: БОАЖЯ, МУИС, ШУА, МУБИС
introduction_mn: Уг хурал анх 2013.10.02-03нд МУИС, ГГС-аас анх санаачилж, II хурлыг 2015.09.25нд зохион байгуулсан. III хурал 2017.01.11-12нд зохион байгуулагдсан. Нийгэм, эдийн засгийн хөгжлийн бодлого боловсруулах, хэрэгжүүлэхэд байгалийн нөхцөл нөөц, нутаг дэвсгэрийн онцлогийг хэрхэн харгалзан үзэх асуудлаар эрдэмтэн, судлаачид санал бодлоо солилцох, цаашид хамтран ажиллахад хурлын зорилго оршино.
introduction_en: Scientists, researchers and institutes expand the academic cooperation and exchange opinions about how the problems of natural conditions, natural resources and territorial location peculiarities influence socio-economic development and development policy of Mongolia. Цель конференции заключается в обмене мнениями и предложениями ученых-исследователей при разработке стратегических задач социально-экономического развития с учетом особенностей территориальных и природных условий, а также в дальнейшем совместном сотрудничестве.

name: Хүрэлтогоот
author: БСШУСЯ, МЗЭХ, МУШУА, ШУТС, ГГСЗЭХ
introduction_mn: БСШУС-ын яам, ШУА, ШУТИС, ШУТС, МЗЭХ, ТИЗСН-ээс залуу судлаачдын дунд жил бүр уламжлал болгон “Хүрэлтогоот” эрдэм шинжилгээний бага хурлыг зохион байгуулдаг уламжлалтай. Шинжлэх ухааны үндсэн чиглэлүүд болох анагаах ухаан, байгалийн ухаан, геологи-газарзүй, хөдөө аж ахуй, техник технологи, нийгмийн ухааны зургаан салбарын эрдэмтэн судлаачид уг хуралд оролцсоноор шинэ мэдлэг мэдээлэл олж авахаас гадна судалгаагаа өргөжүүлэх хоорондоо туршлага солилцох, ОУ-ын хэмжээнд бүтээлээ танилцуулах боломжийг нээж өгдгөөрөө ач холбогдолтой.

name: The 19th National Academic Congress of Psychology and The International Forum of Psychology & the Belt and Road
author: Chinese Psychological Society
introduction_mn: БНХАУ-ын Хятадын сэтгэл судлалын нийгэмлэгээс  "Нэг бүс нэг зам" сэдвийн хүрээнд зохион байгуулсан ОУ-ын хурал нь 2 үндсэн хэсгээр явагдсан. Нэгдүгээр хэсэгт уригдсан орны сэтгэл судлаачид өөрийнхөө орны сэтгэл судлалын хөгжил, ололт амжилт, сүүлийн үеийн судалгаануудыг танилцуулдаг. Хурлын 2-р хэсэг болох дугуй ширээний ярилцлагад орон орны болон бүс нутгийн сэтгэл судлалын нийгэмлэгүүдийн хамтын ажиллагаа, дэмжлэгийн талаар санал бодлоо солилцдог байна.
introduction_en:
The Conference has two sessions. In the academic session, each of the invited speakers would be expected to talk about the current status of psychology in their own country. 
 
In the roundtable session, each of the invited speakers would be expected to talk about the ways of communication that the psychologists in their countries use to communicate with government officials. The goals of these communications would be that of distributing broader psychological knowledge and skills among the people with an intention to benefit both individuals and the society as a whole.

name: National Conference on British and American Studies: Policy Impacts, Dilemmas & Multilateral Relations
introduction_mn:
МУИС-ийн ШУС-ийн Хүмүүнлэгийн салбарын Их Британи Америк судлалын тэнхим, Олон улсын харилцааны хүрээлэнгээс хамтран зохион байгуулж буй “Британи, Америк судлал” сэдэвт эрдэм шинжилгээний хурал 2016 оны 12–р сарын 01- ний өдрийн 13.00 цагт МУИС-ийн хичээлийн 1-р байрны дугуй заланд болно.
Хуралд оролцогчид илтгэлийн сэдвээ 2016 оны 11-р сарын 21-ний өдрөөс өмнө МУИС-ийн ШУС-ийн Хүмүүнлэгийн салбарын batsuren@mail.ru хаягаар илтгэлийн хураангуйг (150-200 үгтэй) бэлтгэж  илгээнэ үү.  2016 оны 11-р сарын 28-ны өдрөөс өмнө хурлын илтгэлийг хэвлэмэл болон цахим хэлбэрээр бэлтгэж  илгээнэ үү.
introduction_en:
NUM is an institution that plays an important part in defining Mongolian foreign policy. The universityoffers foreign languageeducation and research on multilingual and intercultural studies including British and American studies, Russian, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Czech, Polish Studies and others.
       The Department of British and American Studies of the Division of Humanities of NUM together with the Institution of International Relations is going to hold a National Conference titled, “British and American Studies in Mongolia”, on the 1st of December, 2016.
The Conference provides a forum for the exchange of information between the foreign and local institutions that offer academic programs and research on English-speaking countries in areas of study such as history, education, politics, foreign policy and culture. The conference will focus on research results and promote joint research and projects among the participants from the local and international institutions.

name: The Asian Conference on Education and International Development
author: The International Academic Forum
introduction_en:
The International Academic Forum (IAFOR) provides new perspectives to the thought leaders and decision-makers of today and tomorrow by offering constructive environments for dialogue and interchange at the intersections of nation, culture, and discipline.

Headquartered in Japan, with offices in Nagoya and Kobe, IAFOR is an independent think tank committed to the deeper understanding of contemporary geo-political transformation, particularly in the Asia-Pacific region.
The International Academic Forum (IAFOR) is a confederation of leaders and opinion formers around the globe who have one thing in common: a desire to make a difference. It was founded in 2009 by a small group of concerned Asian, European and North American academics and business professionals as a mission-driven politically independent organisation dedicated to providing and promoting meaningful dialogue irrespective of international borders. As the Asia-Pacific region emerges as a new and powerful center of world events to rival the traditional European-American hegemonic axis, different and conflicting nationalistic fears and domestic political interests often dictate negative foreign policies. The stakes for ensuring cooperation between the Asian states and the Western world has never been higher.

Since its founding, IAFOR has been committed to ensuring that Asian leaders and opinion formers in both the public and private sectors, in education, the media, and business, have had the chance to meet their colleagues in other countries, and discuss issues of national and international relevance and importance.

Through its international, intercultural and interdisciplinary conferences, research and publications, IAFOR has become the network hub for information exchange across Asia and beyond; connecting individuals and institutions across the globe, and the thought leaders of today with those of tomorrow. 
The vision of IAFOR grew out of the perceived need to fill a vacuum in the communication and exchange activities of the academic world. Its mission arose out of examining that space and investigating why it existed. The vacuum existed because of the lack of opportunity for serious and thoughtful exchange between academics, members of the global business community, and practitioners in the fields of human endeavor that linked these groups together. In the field of education, for example, we have academic theorists, educational managers (political decision-makers and organisational directors) and classroom teachers with their support staff in IT, library work, exchange programs, and specialist fields. But how often do they have the opportunity to interact?

Moving beyond one particular field, larger questions arise. What function should universities prioritise in the 21st century? What do businesses see as their contribution to social and global well being? How can people on the ground, trying to implement improvements that will transform human life, best be supported? And perhaps above all, what are the agendas that will drive mechanisms to enable these groups to interact effectively.

One piece of distilled thought that came from early exchanges at one of our conferences was the recognition that some of the rhetoric of concern about the problems of developing nations was perhaps over-focused on the term “poverty” because it can be defined only in a relative way. “Hunger” was put forward as being more immediate and itself a contributory factor to poverty, rather than the other way round. One key to the hunger issue could be the provision of safe drinking water, or water for irrigation in some contexts, while flood management might be necessary elsewhere. These, in and by themselves become valuable only insofar as they help to relieve hunger in specific contexts.

IAFOR is affording opportunities that do not exist elsewhere. The base is the beautiful city of Kobe, nestled between the mountains and the sea and in the culturally and historically rich Kansai region, which includes neighbouring Osaka, and nearby Kyoto and Nara. Our conferences present those taking part with three unique dimensions of experience. First of all, it encourages interdisciplinary activity to be expanded. Depending on the field, this can face varying degrees of difficulty, ranging from discouragement to downright prohibition. Those overly dependent on fixed academic structures often see lateral thinking as a threat. None of these negatives apply in IAFOR. Its purpose is to generate new approaches that cross any disciplinary lines. The principle employed is to let the imagination permit intuitive responses to questions. There are no panels of critics. There are simply people who want to listen and reflect. The model of academic work as potholing is replaced by the metaphor of mountaineering. While respecting the need for solid and well-founded academic work, we feel the need to go beyond it from time to time to discover fresh approaches to old questions.

Secondly, it facilitates the heightening of intercultural awareness. Again, we encourage innovation through cross-cultural perception. Cultural roots influence people in their attitudes more than most would realise or admit. The need to see and internalise insights gained from other viewpoints is met by a process of steady illumination.

Thirdly, it promotes the broadening of international exchange. We may live in a globalised world, but in reality parochialism still holds sway. The collapse of the U.S.S.R and the break-up of Yugoslavia led to the re-establishment of numerous former countries. While this may be desirable for the peoples concerned, it merely adds to the world’s cultural confusion. Exchange leads to explanation and that helps the growth of intercultural awareness.

IAFOR makes all of these developments possible in one gathering. Our conferences are not a substitute for specialist conferences. We intend our events to be an alternative that functions as a balance or even a corrective to the extreme tendencies that can arise from more narrowly defined research parameters. In short, IAFOR is promoting and facilitating a new multifaceted approach to one of the core issues of our time, namely globalisation and its many forms of growth and expansion. Awareness of how it cuts across the worlds of business, and academia, along with its impact on societies and institutions is one of the driving forces that has given the organisation its momentum, and is making it a pioneer in this global age.

 TESOL Олон улсын байгууллага  50 жилийн турш  эрдэмтэн судлаачид, сурган хүмүүжүүлэгчид, оюутан суралцагчид, удирдах албан тушаалтнууд  англи хэлийг гадаад хэл болгон зааж буй талаар мэдээлэл, арга туршлагаа солилцох арга хэмжээг зохион байгуулж байна.

name: "Нүүдлийн аялал жуулчлал ба хотуудын тогтвортой хөгжил" Торгоны замын олон улсын бага хурал
author: НҮБ-ын Дэлхийн Аялал жуулчлалын байгууллага (UNWTO), МУ-ын БОАЖЯ, Дэлхийн хотуудын шинжлэх ухааны хөгжлийн холбоо (WCSDA)
introduction_mn: НҮБ-ын Дэлхийн аялал жуулчлалын байгууллага, Байгаль орчин, аялал жуулчлалын яам, Дэлхийн хотуудын шинжлэх ухааны хөгжлийн холбоо, Нийслэлийн Засаг даргын Тамгын газар хамтран “Нүүдлийн аялал жуулчлал ба хотуудын тогтвортой хөгжил сэдэвт” олон улсын анхдугаар бага хурлыг Улаанбаатар хотод 2016.10.13-2016.10.14-ний хооронд зохион байгууллаа. Уг хуралд Торгоны замын аялал жуулчлалын хөтөлбөрийн гишүүн орны сайд нар, аялал жуулчлалын байгууллага зэрэг 33 орны 350 гаруй төлөөлөгч хүрэлцэн ирж оролцсон ба дэлхий дахины аялал жуулчлалын хөгжилд тогтсон хэв маягийг өөрчлөх хандлага бий болсны нэг нь нүүдлийн соёл иргэншлийн замаар аялах нь цоо шинэ мэдрэмж, шинэлэг аяллын бүтээгдэхүүн бий болгох төлөвийг нээж байгааг мэргэжилтнүүд онолын ба практик судалгааны илтгэлүүдээрээ дамжуулан нотлон хэлэлцүүлсэн юм. Энэ нь Монгол Улсад энэхүү дэлхийн хэмжээний аялал жуулчлалыг хөгжүүлэхэд их ач холбогдолтой ба монголчуудын соёлоороо ялгарах нэг боломж болохыг нотолсон нь хурлын хамгийн гол онцлог байв.
introduction_en:
The World Tourism Organization (UNWTO), together with the Ministry of Environment and Tourism of Mongolia and the World Cities Scientific Development Alliance (WCSDA), organized the International Silk Road Conference on Nomadic Tourism and Sustainable Cities in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia on 13-15 October 2016.

The conference gathered Ministers and high-level officials from nine UNWTO Silk Road Member States, official representatives from Silk Road regions, the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO), and UNWTO Affiliate Members to address the potential of nomadic and sustainable city tourism. The event, officially opened by the Chairman of the State Great Hural of Mongolia, Mr. Enkhbold Miyegombo, attracted over 350 delegates from 21 countries.

The Silk Road has become one of the most visited international travel routes. Despite such growth, an increase in visitation also brings challenges, such as the protection of the environment and the maintenance of necessary heritage standards. Bearing in mind the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG’s) and the upcoming International Year for Sustainable Development for Tourism 2017, participants discussed  these challenges and the large potential  of developing  nomadic tourism trails and products.

Осакагийн эдийн засаг хуульзүйн их сургууль ба Бээжингийн Их сургуулийн Ази судлалын институт ба Зүүн Ази судлалын төвөөс байнга зохион байгуулж, Азийн аль нэг нэр бүхий Их сургууль уг хурлыг хүлээн авагч сургуулиар ээлжлэн зохиүн байгуулдаг уламжлалтай.
introduction_en: The East Asian Research Institute was established in December 1987 for purpose of contributing to the peace and prosperity of East Asia through academic research on east Asia, in addition to conducting exchange and promoting development within the East Asia region. The Asian Research Institute and Centre for East Asian Studies have jointly held a large number of international symposiums, since 2000.9 to 2014.9 there were hold 1st- 8th ICEAS in Asian universities.

The first think tank forum for China, Russia and Mongolia was held in Ulan Bator, capital of Mongolia, on Sept 17, where a think tank cooperation association was set up between the three sides.
The forum was co-organized by the International Cooperation Bureau of the Development Research Center of China’ State Council, Development Research Center of the Inner Mongolia autonomous region of China, the Far East research institute of Russia’s Academy of Sciences, Mongolia’s Academy of Sciences and the National University of Mongolia.
The second forum was held in Huhhot, Inner Mongolia, PR.China on 28-29 Sep. 2016, under the theme of "China-Mongolia-Russia economic corridor: Connection and Expansion"

author: 22, 2The Forum is hosted by China Law Society, organized by Jilin Law Society and Jilin University and co-organized by Shandong University, Liaoning University, Heilongjiang University and Inner Mongolia University.
introduction_mn: Зүүн хойд Азийн хамтын ажиллагааны Азийн хамтын ажиллагааны нэг чухал хэсэг юм. Сүүлийн жилүүдэд, Зүүн хойд Азийн хамтын ажиллагаа зэрэг АСЕАН-ы + 3, RCEP, Зүүн хойд Азийн эдийн засгийн хамтын ажиллагааны талаар эерэг ахиц дэвшил гаргасан, Ази, Номхон далайн чөлөөт худалдааны бүс байгуулах зэрэг энэ бүс нутгийн улс орнуудын харилцаа, байнга ойрхон байна , хууль эрэлт мөн өсч байна. Бид бүс нутгийн олон талт эрдэм шинжилгээний солилцоо, нөөцийн хуваалцах дэмжих Зүүн хойд Азийн хамтын ажиллагааны илүү эрх зүйн үйлчилгээ, оюуны дэмжлэг үзүүлэх ажил хэрэгч хууль эрх зүйн хамтын ажиллагааг бэхжүүлэх, Хятад, Япон, БНСУ ЧХХ болон Зүүн хойд Азийн эрх зүйн судалгаа сайжруулах зорилт тавин ажиллаж байна бүс нутаг, Зүүн хойд Азийн энх тайван, тогтвортой байдал, хөгжил цэцэглэлтийн идэвхтэй хувь нэмэр болгож байна.
introduction_en: The cooperation of Northeast Asia is an important part of Asia cooperation. In recent years, the cooperation of Northeast Asia has made positive progress, such as ASEAN+3, RCEP, Northeast Asia economic cooperation, the Asia-Pacific Free Trade Area construction and etc. The relationship of the countries in this region is constantly close, and the demand for law is also increasing. We are committed to enhancing the legal research of China-Japan-ROK FTA and Northeast Asia, promoting the regional multilateral academic exchange and resource sharing, providing the preferable legal service and intellectual support for the cooperation of Northeast Asia, reinforcing the pragmatic legal cooperation of the region, and making active contributions to the peace, stability and prosperity of Northeast Asia.

name: International Conference on Chinese classics and Studies of History and Culture of the Silk Road
author: Renmin University of China

name: China-Mongolia-Russia Think Tank Forum
author: Хятадын ӨМӨЗО-ны хөгжлийн судалгааны төв
introduction_mn: Хятад-Монгол-Орос улсын төрийн тэргүүн, гадаад явдлын яамны сайд нарын уулзалтаар “Think Tаnk Forum” 2015 онд байгуулагдах болж, ӨМӨЗО-ны хөгжлийн судалгааны төв, МУИС, ОХУ-ын Тинк Танкын холбоо хамтран анхны хурлыг 2015 оны 08-р сард зохион байгуулсан. Уламжлал болгон жил бүр зохион байгуулахаар тогтсон.
introduction_en: This conference is initiated between the China, Russia and Mongolia the trilateral cooperation. It has been a consensus of the state heads and conforms to the common interests of these three countries. In the March of 2015, the vice foreign affairs ministers of three states have reached an agreement in Beijing on the plan to construct the Think Tank Center of China, Russia and Mongolia. As one of the initiators of the 1st Trilateral Think Тank Forum, the Developmental Research Center of Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region of China founded “1st Trilateral Think Tank Forum 2015”.

name: эволюция И СОВРЕМЕННОЕ СОСТОЯНИЕ ЛАНДШАФТОВ И БИОТЫ ВНУТРЕННЕЙ АЗИИ
author: МИНИСТЕРСТВО ОБРАЗОВАНИЯ И НАУКИ РОССИЙСКОЙ ФЕДЕРАЦИИ Федеральное государственное бюджетное образовательное учреждение высшего образования «Восточно-Сибирский государственный университет технологий и управления» Федеральное государственное бюджетное образовательное учреждение высшего образования «Бурятский государственный университет»
introduction_mn:
В сборнике освещено современное состояние и эволюция ландшафтов
и биоты Внутренней Азии: теория, методология и методика
исследований, структура и пространственно-временная динамика
эволюции природной среды. Воспроизведены палеогеографическая
обстановка и динамика изменения животного и растительного мира;
рассмотрена палеогеография древних поселений; приведены новые г
данные современного состояния ландшафтов с ожидаемыми последствиями
антропогенного влияния на природную среду.
Предназначен широкому кругу читателей, занимающихся теоретическими
и практическими вопросами четвертичной геологии, эволюционной
и физической

introduction_mn: Д.Нацагдоржийн мэндэлсний 110 жилийн ойд зориулсан үйл ажиллагааны нэгдсэн хөтөлбөрийн хүрээнд уг хурал Төв аймгийн ЗДТГ-ын байранд болж Монгол, ОХУ, Буриад, БНХАУ, Өвөр монголын 26 эрдэмтэн судлаачид илтгэл тавьсан
introduction_en: Great writer for the international scientific conference Dashdorj Natsagdorj 110 anniversary of the birth

name: The South Korea, Mongolia and China's Legal Project
author: БНСУ -ын Чон Буг Их Сургуулийн Зүүн хойд Азийн эрх зүйн судалгааны хүрээлэн
introduction_mn: БНСУ -ын Чон Буг Их Сургуулийн  Хууль Зүйн Дээд Сургуулийн Зүүн хойд Азийн эрх зүйн судалгааны хүрээлэн нь Зүүн Хойд Азийн улс орны хууль зүйн сургууль болон эрдэмтэн судлаачидтай холбоотой үйл ажиллагаа явуулдаг. БНСУ -ын Чонбук үндэсний их сургуулийн Хууль зүйн дээд сургууль нь МУИС -ийн ХЗС -тай хамтран ажиллах гэрээ байгуулсан үеэс хууль зүйн эрдэмтэн судлаачтай хамтран олон улсын хурлыг зохион байгуулах болсон болно.

name: Asian Conference of Religions for Peace ACRP
author: ACRP
introduction_mn: Азийн олон шашинтныг дэлхийн энх тайван аюулгүй байдлын төлөө нэгтгэсэн олон улсын байгууллага. 1976 онд байгуулагдсан НҮБ-д бүртгэлтэй шашин энх тайвны төлөө олон улсын байгууллага болно. Японы Токио хотод төвтэй.
introduction_en: Religions for peace Asia (also known as ACRP) is the world's largest regional body of religiously inspired people working for peace and interreligious harmony

introduction_mn: МОНГОЛ УЛС, ЯПОН УЛСЫН ХУУЛЬ ТОГТООМЖИЙН ХӨГЖИЛ, БИЗНЕСТ ҮЗҮҮЛЭХ НӨЛӨӨ сэдэвт олон улсын симпозиум нь Монгол болон Японы судлаачдын дунд зохион байгуулсан бөгөөд Монгол Японы худалдааны эрх зүйн харьцуулсан судалгааны дүнг танилцуулсан болно
introduction_en: International symposium on Influence of Mongolian and Japanese law on business is organized to introduce comparative study of Mongolian and Japanese commercial laws

name: the international symposium "70 th anniversary oe MPE of academy of sciences, USSR"
author: ШУА, Палеонтологи Геологийн хүрээлэн
introduction_mn: ЗХУ-ын Монголын палеонтологийн экспедициын хамгийн чухал олдворт газруудыг олж судалсан судалгааг 1946-1949 онуудад хийгдсэн бөгөөд энэ ажлын талаар Ефремовын судадгааны тайлангуудад нагрийн бичигдсэн байдаг.
introduction_en: In 1946-1949, the MPE worked and excavated  late cretaceous dinosuars, in the Nemegt region results of the MPE have been described in detail by Efremov.

name: Evolution and modern condition of landscapes and biota of inner Asia
author: Buryat State University
introduction_mn: Төв Азийн ландшафт, ургамал амьтны өнөөгийн нөхцөл байдал болон хувьсал өөрчлөлтийн тухай илтгэлүүд
introduction_en: Collected articles is about modern condition and evolution of landscapes and biota of Inner Asia: theory, research methodology, structure and spatio-temporal dynamic of natural environment evolution.

name: Монгол Улсын хувийн эрх зүйн тулгамдсан асуудал: Иргэний болон Худалдааны хууль тогтоомжийн олон улсын жишиг
introduction_mn: Тус хурлыг МУИС-ХЗС-иас санаачилан УИХ-ын Тамгын газар, Хууль зүйн яам, Монголын Хуульчдын холбоо хамтран анх удаа 2016 оны 10 сарын 21-ны өдөр зохион байгуулсан.
introduction_en: This symposium first time organized by NUM School of law and cooperated State great hural secretary of Mongolia, Ministry of Justice, Mongolian Bar Association 21st, October 2016.

name: ШУТИС-н Гадаад Хэлний Институтын Гадаад Хэлний Заах арга зүйн семинар
author: ШУТИС-н Гадаад Хэлний Институт
introduction_mn: 2016 оны 3 сарын 5 нд ШУТИС-н Гадаад Хэлний Институтын зохион явуулсан " Их сургуулиудийн Англи хэлний сургалтанд Мэдээллийн Технологийг ашиглах нь " сэдэвт семинар амжилттай болж өнгөрлөө. Уг семинарт ШУТИС, МУИС, МУБИС болон ХААИС-н Англи хэлний багш судлаачид оролцов. Нийт 9 эрдэм шинжилгээний илтгэлийг авч хэлэлцсэн бөгөөд илтгэл бүрийн дараа дээрх сургуулиудийн эрдэмтэд уг илтгэлийн шүүмжийг танилцуулсан нь ихээхэн сонирхолтой байсан. Семинар Англи хэл дээр явагдсан бөгөөд семинарын дараа илтгэлүүдийг Seminar Proceedings хэвлүүлсэн болно.
introduction_en: Seminar on "ICT Use in Teaching English to University students" was held on 5 March 2016. English teachers from MUST, NUM, MNUE, MUA were participated. The Welcome speech was presented by Soyolsuren Baasanjav /PhD/ vice Director of Foreign Affairs and Innovation, Institute of Foreign Languages of MUST. 9 papers were presented and 9 reviewers of the papers were given their reviews. The official language of the seminar was English.

name: Biodiversity Research in Mongolia
introduction_mn: МУИС ба ХБНГУ-ын Халле-Виттенбергийн их сургууль хоорондын хамтын ажиллагааны 50 жилийн ойд зориулсан "Монгол орны биологийн олон янз байдлын судалгаа" сэдэвт олон улсын эрдэм шинжилгээний бага хурал
introduction_en: The international conference on “Biodiversity Research in Mongolia” is dedicated to the 50th anniversary of research and cooperation between the Martin-Luther University Halle-Wittenberg and National University of Mongolia. The conference will bring together leading academic scientists, researchers, scholars and students in the field of biodiversity research in Mongolia from around the world.

name: Боловсролын сэтгэл зүйн тулгамдсан асуудал, шийдэл, арга зам
author: МУБИС
introduction_mn: Боловсролын сэтгэл зүйн тулгамдсан асуудал, шийдэл, арга зам үндэсний эрдэм шинжилгээний хурлыг 2017 оны 1 сарын 16-17 -ны өдрүүдэд МУБИС, МУИС, БҮТ, БМДИ  хамтран зохион байгууллаа. Энэ нь суралцахуйн сэтгэл зүйн хүчин зүйлийг авч үзсэн 3 дахь удаагийн хурал болно.
introduction_en: Educational psychology conference jointly organized by Mongolian Educational University, National University of Mongolia, Institute of Teacher Professional Development , Educational Assessment Center on 16-17 January, 2017. It's the third national conference to be focused on the educational psychological factors of students' learning.

name: Монгол дахь ёс суртахууны боловсрол: Уламжлал, шинэчлэл
Аристотель ба орчин үеийн философи сэтгэлгээ
The Gerege - Values of Asian Civilization in the 7th-8th Century of Hijry\ XIII-XIV Century
"Цайны зам"-ын эрдэм шинжилгээний анхдугаар бага хурал
author: Нийслэлийн Аялал Жуулчлалын Газар, Цайны соёл нийгэмлэг, Монголын Үндэсний музей
introduction_mn: Дорныг Өрнөтэй холбосон худалдааны их зам бий болсон нь 200 гаруй жилийн түүхэн үйл явц бөгөөд өдгөө “Цайны зам” хэмээн нэрлэгдэж байгаа аж. Уг замаар Хятад улс 1928 онд Монголд экспортын бүрэн хориг тавих хүртэл 200 жил цай зэрэг чухал барааг тээвэрлэж байжээ. Тэгвэл энэхүү худалдааны их замаар хүмүүс цайг хэрхэн, хаанаас тээвэрлэж, энэ нь Монголд ямар үр ашигтай байсан тухай ОХУ, БНХАУ-ын судлаачид судалж эхэлжээ. Мөн гурван улсын төрийн тэргүүнүүд тус худалдааны замыг шинэчлэн сэргээж, аялал жуулчлал, эдийн засгийн үр шимийг дахин ашиглахаар шийдвэрлэсэн нь “Цайны зам”-ын судалгааг эрчимтэй хийх шаардлагыг бий болгосон байна. Нийслэлийн аялал жуулчлалын газар, “Цайны соёл” нийгэмлэг, “Монголиан Корпорейт Травел” ХХК зэрэг байгууллагаас санаачлан зохион байгуулсан “Цайны зам”-ын эрдэм шинжилгээний анхдугаар бага хурал  болж, тус хуралд нийт найман илтгэл хэлэлцэгдлээ.

name: JGU Meeting
author: Japanese Geomorphological Union
introduction_mn: Японы Геоморфологийн Нийгэмлэг нь жилд 2 удаа хурлыг зохион байгуулдаг.
introduction_en: The JPU organizes JPU Meeting twice a year and publishes results from geomorphological processes, methods and new techniques on all field of Geomorphology in Transactions, JGU.

name: Олон улсын харилцааны байдал төлөв ба Монгол улс
The 5th International Asia-Europe Conference "Can Regions understand each other? Asia-Europe: Challenges and Crisis-Management"
author: Le Havre University, France
introduction_mn:
МУИС-ийн ОУХНУС, ШУУС-ийн УТСТ, МУ-ын ШУА-ийн ОУХХ-ээс Францын Хаврын их сургууль, Казахстаны их сургуультай хамтран зохион байгуулж буй Ази, Европын V ОУЭШХ 2016 оны 5 дугаар сарын 26-27-ны өдрүүдэд МУИС-ийн “Монгол, Японы төв”-д болж өнгөрөв. Энэ удаагийн Ази, Европын бага хурлын сэдэв нь “Бүс нутгууд харилцан ойлголцож чадах уу? Ази, Европ: сорилт, хямрал зохицуулалт” байлаа. Эрдэм шинжилгээний олон улсын бага хурлын нээлтэд МУИС-ийн дэд захирал Б.Болдгив, Казахстан Улсаас Монголд суугаа Онц бөгөөд бүрэн эрхт элчин сайд Калибек Ибрагимович Кобландин, Францын хэргийг түр хамаарагч Рафаель Дросзевски, тус бага хурлыг санаачлагч Францын Хаврын их сургуулийн профессор П.Шабал нар оролцож, үг хэлэв. Энэхүү эрдэм шинжилгээний хуралд Бельги, ОХУ, Франц, Хятад, Казахстан, Киргизстан, Япон, Монголын эрдэмтэн судлаачид, профессорууд оролцож, хэлэлцэж байгаа сэдвээр нийт 40 гаруй илтгэлийг тавьж  хэлэлцүүлэв. 
Тус хуралдаан нь хоёр өдрийн турш зохион байгуулагдсан ба 4 салбарт хуваагдан нийт 37 илтгэл хэлэлцэгдлээ.  Үүнийг тус бүрээр нь авч үзвэл: 
	Олон Улсын Дипломат Үйл Ажиллагааны асуудлууд салбар - 11 илтгэл
	Нийгэм Бодлогын асуудлууд салбар - 10 илтгэл
	Эдийн Засаг, Хөгжлийн асуудлууд салбар -6 илтгэл
	Хямрал Зохицуулах асуудлууд салбар – 10 илтгэл тус тус хэлэлцэгдсэн юм. 
   Салбар хуралдаан тус бүрийг гадаад, дотоодын мэргэжлийн 2 хүн удирдсан бөгөөд энэ удаагийн  олон улсын хурлын бүх илтгэлүүд англи хэлээр тавигдаж, хэлэлцүүлэг англи, япон, франц хэлээр санал бодлоо солилцсон ажил хэрэгч уур амьсгалтай арга хэмжээ болж өнгөрснийг хурлын төлөөлөгчид хаалтын арга хэмжээнд дүгнэж байсныг онцлон тэмдэглэж байна. Казахстаны их сургуулийн Олон улсын харилцаа ба дэлхийн эдийн засаг тэнхимийн эрхлэгч  проф. Kuralay  Baizakova тус хурлыг хааж хэлсэн үгэндээ уг хуралд МУИС-ийн залуу судлаачид өргөнөөр оролцож, судалгааны ажлын үр дүнгээ хэлэлцүүлсэн нь их сонирхолтой байлаа. Ахмад үе, залуу үе, дунд насны бүх судлаачдын төлөөлөл тэнцвэртэй байж үзэл бодлоо илэрхийлсэн сонирхолтой хурал боллоо гэж дүгнэсэн юм.
introduction_en:
«Can Regions Understand Each Other ? Asia-Europe : challenges and crisis-management » 5th International Europe-Asia conference The National University of Mongolia, Oulan Bator, 26th-27th May 2016 оrganised by The National University of Mongolia School of International Relations and Public Administration, SIRPA and School of Social Sciences, department of Political Science, SSS Le Havre University, Research Center in Law and International Exchanges, LexFEIM. In collaboration with The National Kazakh University, KazNU al-Farabi (2014 conference) The Namik Kemal University, Turkey (2018 conference)
Papers are invited for the above-titled conference, marking the 5th Europe-Asia international cooperation of the “Europe-Asia 2014 research group” and the 2016 ASEM meeting to be held in Mongolia. Further to the first Europe-Asia conferences exploring regional regime dynamics (France, 2004), policies of regional cooperation (Korea, 2005), interregional cooperation (France, 2012) and the limits of regional constructions (Kazakhstan, 2014) this 2016 edition will look at the reciprocal understanding of regions and how that is conducive to their capacity or lack thereof to monitor crises they undergo, both specific crises and interregional ones. Papers must address original research in regional dynamics of Asia and Europe, since the end of the cold war and focus on one area among:
Session 1 : INTERNATIONAL/DIPLOMATIC  ISSUES : Sub-topics suggested :
Regions, meta-regions, sub-regions ?, A role for non-regional actors ?, Crises in Ukraine, North Korea, Greece, Afghanistan …, Enlargement of organisations: SCO, EU, EEC, OSCE ..., Diplomatic negotiations and progresses …, Nature of a dialogue among partners

Session 2 : SOCIETAL/POLICY ISSUES : Sub-topics suggested :
Democratic reforms and transitions, Religion and political secularism, Public opinion, identity, Terrorism and intervention, Migrations, labour, employment, Markets and consumers …

Session 3 : ECONOMIC/DEVELOPMENT ISSUES: Sub-topics suggested :
Geographic planning, Industrial development, Business councils, Banking dynamics, Foreign investments, Transport and logistics …
Selected papers will be published in Public Administration and Regional Studies (Rumanian, English or French), Contemporary Political Society (English), World Affairs (English, Mongolian, Russian or Chinese).

name: Global Land Project 3rd Open Science Meeting
introduction_en:
What is the Global Land Programme (GLP)?

GLP is an interdisciplinary community of science and practice fostering the study of land systems and the co-design of solutions for global sustainability.

Land use is a major driver of global change. GLP sees land as the nexus of crucial societal and environmental challenges and opportunities to address food security, access to water, livelihoods, land degradation, biodiversity loss, and climate change. Solutions to these challenges must balance complex trade-offs and synergies at multiple scales, demanding multiple paradigms and perspectives.

Within GLP, collaboration is fostered amongst a network of scientists, institutions, and stakeholders engaged in building and enhancing scientific capacity through identifying core questions, synthesizing research and setting future agendas. GLP aims at creating synergies among researchers and stakeholders, and bridging science and decision making.

name: The 23rd Session of the Asia-Pacific Regional Space Agency Forum (APRSAF-23)
introduction_en:
What's APRSAF?

The Asia-Pacific Regional Space Agency Forum (APRSAF) was established in 1993 to enhance space activities in the Asia-Pacific region.

Space agencies, governmental bodies, international organizations, private companies, universities, and research institutes from over 40 countries and regions take part in APRSAF, the largest space-related conference in the Asia-Pacific region. The increasing attendance of high-ranking officials at APRSAF events provides opportunities to discuss international cooperation for space activities in concrete terms.

APRSAF currently organizes four working groups—Space Applications, Space Technology, Space Environment Utilization, and Space Education—to share information about the activities and future plans of each country and region in these respective areas. APRSAF also supports the establishment of international projects as solutions for common issues, such as disaster management and environmental protection, so that participating parties will benefit from mutual cooperation

introduction_mn: Геодез, Геофизикийн Олон Улсын Нийгэмлэг нь анх 1919 онд байгуулагдсан. Дэлхий Судлалын Шинжлэх Ухааны судалгааны үр дүнг дэмжиж ажилладаг.
introduction_en:
International Union of Geodesy and Geophysics (IUGG) is a non-governmental, scientific organization, established in 1919.
IUGG is one of the 32 scientific Unions presently grouped within the International Council for Science (ICSU).
IUGG is dedicated to the international promotion and coordination of scientific studies of Earth (physical, chemical, and mathematical) and its environment in space. These studies include the shape of the Earth, its gravitational and magnetic fields, the dynamics of the Earth as a whole and of its component parts, the Earth's internal structure, composition and tectonics, earthquakes and elastic wave propagation, the generation of magmas, volcanism and rock formation, the hydrological cycle including snow and ice, all aspects of the oceans, the atmosphere, ionosphere, magnetosphere and solar-terrestrial relations, and analogous problems associated with the Moon and other planets. IUGG encourages the application of this knowledge to societal needs, such as mineral resources, mitigation of natural hazards and environmental preservation.

name: 2nd China-Japan-ROK Legal Forum & 4th Northeast Asia Legal Forum
author: Jilin University, Changchun, China
introduction_mn:
Хятад улсад "Хятад-Япон улсын 2 дахь удаагийн форум- Хойд Азийн 4 дэх удаагийн форум"-д зориулсан "Хятадын хууль зүйн нийгэмлэг" болон "Жинлин" Хуулийн сургуультай хамтран зохион байгуулсан олон улсын эрдэм шинжилгээний хуралд илтгэл тавьж оролцсон.
Тус олон улсын эрдэм шинжилгээний хурлын гол зорилго нь Азийн улс орнуудын ялангуяа Хойд Азин орнуудын эрх зүйн шинэчлэлт цаашдын хамтын ажиллагааг өргөжүүлэхтэй холбоотой байсан бөгөөд нийт 27 илтгэгч оролцсон.
introduction_en: From Otc.21 to 22, 2016, the 2nd China-Japan-ROK Legal Forum & 4th Northeast Asia Legal Forum was held successfully in Changchun. The Forum was sponsored by China Law Society (CLS), and jointly organized by Jilin University and Jilin Law Society. More than 150 legal experts and practitioners from Japan, South Korea, Mongolia, Russia,  the United States of America, Cambodia, Indonesia and China participated in the Forum. The theme of the Forum was “Strengthening the Regional Legal Cooperation and Creating the New Future of Northeast Asia”.  Mr. Zhang Mingqi, Vice President of CLS, Ambassador Yang Houlan, Secretary-General of Trilateral Cooperation Secretariat, Mr. Li Shenxue, Vice President of Jilin Law Society, Mr. Kenji Yamagish, Chairman of Japan-China Lawyers Friendship Relationship Association, Mr.Ganbaatar Banzragch, President of Association of Mongolia Advocates, Mr. Bing Zheng, Executive Vice President of Jilin University attended the Opening Ceremony and delivered speeches. Mr. Cai Lidong, Dean of Law School of Jilin University hosted the Opening Ceremony. The unveiling ceremony of the Northeast Asia Legal Research Center and Northeast Asia High-Level Legal Talents Training Base was also held during the Opening Ceremony.

name: The Establishment of a Framework for Researches on Application of Space Technology for Disaster Monitoring  in the APSCO Member States
author: Asia-Pacific Space Cooperation Organization
introduction_en: The present project is a knowledge building project and the system involved for it is a framework of human network for gathering and transfer of knowledge on the application of space technology for disaster monitoring. Combination of knowledge and experiences of the researchers of different countries would be much more effective to fulfill the requirements of information needed for effective management of the disasters.  Provided that the organizational structure of the framework is functional, this project will facilitate to combine the knowledge and experiences of the researchers/experts of the Member States (MS) of APSCO in effective monitoring disasters through application of space technology. The mechanism to be used in this project for combining the expert knowledge is the exchange of information among the relevant researchers/experts of the MS through Technical Sessions (TS) and Joint Research Programs (JRP). Therefore, in order to implement the project successfully the MS needs to play some specific roles.

XIX INQUA Congress
author: International Union for Quaternary Research
introduction_mn: Дөрөвдөгч Судлалын бүх салбарыг хамардаг.
introduction_en:
Since 1928, INQUA, the International Union for Quaternary Research, has promoted communication and international collaboration in Quaternary research. The current scientific scope of INQUA is reflected by its five Commissions:
- Coastal and Marine Processes
- Palaeoclimate
- Humans and Biosphere
- Stratigraphy and Chronology
- Terrestrial Processes, Deposits and History
The Congress program will address the themes of the Commissions during 6 days of oral and poster sessions, plenary presentations, and side meetings. The scientific program will be garnished with social events at scenic spots, and of course, in the tradition of INQUA Congresses, with attractive field trips before, during, and after the Congress week.

name: European Geosciences Union General Assembly 2016
author: European Geosciences Union
introduction_mn: Дэлхий Судлалын Шинжлэх Ухааны бүх салбарыг хамардаг.
introduction_en:
EGU, the European Geosciences Union, is Europe’s premier geosciences union, dedicated to the pursuit of excellence in the Earth, planetary, and space sciences for the benefit of humanity, worldwide. It was established in September 2002 as a merger of the European Geophysical Society (EGS) and the European Union of Geosciences (EUG), and has headquarters in Munich, Germany. It is a non-profit international union of scientists with over 12,500 members from all over the world. Membership is open to individuals who are professionally engaged in or associated with geosciences and planetary and space sciences and related studies, including students and retired seniors.

The EGU has a current portfolio of 17 diverse scientific journals, which use an innovative open access format, and organises a number of topical meetings, and education and outreach activities. Its annual General Assembly is the largest and most prominent European geosciences event, attracting over 11,000 scientists from all over the world. The meeting’s sessions cover a wide range of topics, including volcanology, planetary exploration, the Earth’s internal structure and atmosphere, climate, as well as energy and resources.

introduction_en: I was invited as a keynote speaker to the Winter school “Cultural Diversity and Income Inequality” held near Ekaterinburg (Russia) from 15 till 19 December, 2016.

name: The 8th International Geochronology Summer School: Dating techniques in environmental research
author: University of Zurich, Switzerland
introduction_mn: Геохронологийн аргуудыг докторант болон пост-док судлаачдад сургалтыг зохион байгуулдаг.
introduction_en: Topics to be covered in lectures, excursions and workshops include dating techniques such as numerical methods (radiocarbon, exposure dating with cosmogenic nuclides, OSL, 137Cs, 210Pb, etc.), dendrochronology, anthracology, archaeomagnetic dating, as well as relative methods like soil weathering and Schmidt-hammer technique. The Summer School is open to young researchers (PhD students and Post-Docs) worldwide.

name: The  4th SEAHRN International Conference on Human Rights and Peace in Southeast Asia
author: IHRP, Mahidol University, Thailand
introduction_en: SEAHRN is a consortium of human rights and peace academics and scholars from 22 university-based Southeast Asian institutions that conduct study programs, research and outreach activities on human rights, peace and conflict studies. Since 2015, SEAHRN became part of the broader endeavor of Strengthening Human Rights and Peace Research and Education in ASEAN/Southeast Asia (SHAPE-SEA). To achieve the objective of creating a Southeast Asian culture based on human rights and peace principles, SEAHRN has been organizing the biennial SEAHRN International Conference on Human Rights and Peace in Southeast Asia since 2010. To date, we have brought together over 1,200 academics, researchers, students, representatives from diplomatic missions, members of civil society organizations and members of government and inter-government agencies working on human rights and peace in the region and beyond.

introduction_mn: Олон Улсын Геоморфологичдын Нийгэмлэг нь 4 жилд 1 удаа Олон Улсын Их Хурал, 2 жилд 1 удаа бүс нутгийн хурлыг зохион байгуулдаг.
introduction_en: International Association of Geomorphologists (IAG/AIG) is a scientific, non-governmental and non-profit organisation, whose principal objectives are development and promotion of geomorphology as a science through international co-operation and dissemination of knowledge of geomorphology. The IAG/AIG was founded at the Second International Conference on Geomorphology in Frankfurt/Main (Germany) in 1989 in order to strengthen international geomorphology. IAG/AIG fulfils its aims through the establishment of working groups and task forces, organisation of international and regional conferences, publication activity and information exchange. Membership of the IAG/AIG is normally by countries. At present, 63 countries are affiliated to the IAG/AIG through their National Scientific Members. The activity of the IAG/AIG is steered by its Executive Committee.

name: Japanese Geoscience Union (JpGU) Meeting
author: Japanese Geoscience Union (JpGU)
introduction_mn: Японы Дэлхий Судлалын Нийгэмлэг нь жил бүр хурлыг олон улсын түвшинд зохион байгуулдаг бөгөөд Дэлхий Судлалын Шинжлэх Ухааны бүх салбарыг хамардаг.
introduction_en:
The JpGU, or Japan Geoscience Union, is a public interest incorporated association as defined under the Japanese law. We are an academic union that covers all the disciplines of Earth and planetary sciences and related fields. Our members are individuals who are researchers, engineers, educators, science communicators, students and the general public with interests in the science and academic societies concerned with the full range of subjects covered by Earth and planetary sciences. As of September 30, 2016 the membership of JpGU consists of over 8000 individual members and 50 society members.
We represent the Japanese community of Earth and planetary scientists, promote the science, provide a platform for communications among the members, coordinate internationally, and reach out to the public; thus contributing to the advancement and dissemination of Earth and planetary sciences.JpGU supports international discussion and exchange that contributes to driving the boundaries of our science and understanding further forward and stimulate the global Earth and planetary science community. We firmly believe that the advancement of our science will contribute to the well-being of the human race.
The scientific functions of JpGU are currently conducted by five independent Science Sections. They are: space and planetary sciences, atmospheric and hydrographic sciences, human geosciences, solid Earth sciences, and biogeosciences. Our main activities are the annual scientific meeting held in spring and the publication of our peer reviewed journal (Progress in Earth and Planetary Sciences). Other activities are targeted towards promotion of the science and public outreach steered by various committees and by publication of quarterly Newsletters.

name: III Всеросcийская конференция "Фундаментальная гликобиология “
author: Федеральное государственное бюджетное учреждение науки Тихоокеанский институт биоорганической химии им. Г.Б. Елякова ДВО РАН
introduction_en:
Сборник включает тезисы докладов участников конференции,
организованной Тихоокеанским институтом биоорганической химии им.
Г.Б. Елякова ДВО РАН. Представленные работы посвящены актуальным
проблемам современной гликобиологии, включая исследование структуры и
биологической активности гликанов и гликоконьюгатов, изучение их роли в
биологических системах, углевод-белковые взаимодействия, химический и
ферментативный синтез углеводов и гликоконъюгатов, новые методы
структурного анализа углеводов, использование гликанов и гликан-содержащих
комплексов в биомедицине и биотехнологии. Материалы представляют интерес
для специалистов, работающих как в области химии и биохимии углеводов, так
и междисциплинарных наук – клеточной биологии, молекулярной генетики,
физиологии и медицины.

name: The 3rd International conference on Social Sciences, Business, Technology and Management (SBTM)
author: Association of Social Sciences and Humanities
introduction_en:
About Us
What is Social Sciences and Humanities Association?
The Social Sciences Association is an interdisciplinary group of scholars that shares interests in social life and theory and social-scientific methodologies in this modern world. SSA might be best seen as an alliance of distinguished scholarly communities. Our fundamental intellectual work ranges from everyday life to corporate field in the technological world having rapid innovation changes.We are united in our modern innovative and academic approach to understand the research processes and developing innovative theory.
In pursuit of academic excellence, ANISSH develops policies and programs that enhance professional opportunities for Social Sciences and Humanities faculty members, and promotes activities that support increased student enrollments in colleges and universities related to this field. Strong communication and collaboration with national and international organizations further advances ANI’s mission. ANI also fulfills its mission by providing a valuable communication link among corporations, government agencies, and educational institutions.
Our Vision:
Our vision is to establish sustainable research and academic hub for future generations.
Our Mission:
Our mission is to encourage global communication and collaboration; promote professional interaction and lifelong learning; recognize outstanding contributions of individuals and organizations. 
Core Values:
Accountability
Diversity
Respect
Social Responsibility
Integrity
Our Partners
As a corporate partner, you have numerous opportunities to engage the research community, influence the conversation, and promote your brand. You will be partnered with key decision makers and administrators from universities around the globe.We welcome academic research institutions for joint collaboration in knowledge generation and dissemination through our platform”

name: International Conference on “Business, Economics, Social Science & Humanities-” (BESSH January 25- 26, 2017 Seoul Korea).
author: Society of Business, Economics, Social Science & Humanities, Academic fora
introduction_en:
Vision

Our vision is to promote research excellence through networking Platform.

Mission

In Academic Fora we are continuously striving to provide an academic hub to scholarly communities worldwide. Where scholars are encouraged to play their role to help society through novel and advance research ideas and provide technological solutions to bring peace, harmony, prosperity and growth to humanity.
