name: World Ant Forum Bangkok, 2019 and the 12th ANeT Meeting
introduction_en:
Aims and goals of ANeT

ANeT (International Network for the Study of Asian Ants) was founded in 1999 for the promotion and communication of all kinds myrmecological of research in Asia, ranging from the fields of ecology, taxonomy, systematics, phylogeny, morphology to social behavior and many more.

The aim of ANeT goal is connect research on Asian ants all over the world by offering a platform for communication and exchange. A further goal of ANeT is to support the next generation of myrmecologists in Asia and to connect them to those already being in business.

Therefore the primary mean of ANeT is the organization of an international conference which currently will be held in every other year at various locations around Asia.

Since 2007 the peer reviewed, open access journal Asian Myrmecology, is published by the Universiti Malaysia Sabah, on behalf of ANeT. Asian Myrmecology has an increasingly rising impact factor and an on-line-first publication policy that enables speedy publication. The subjects of the papers published in Asian Myrmecology reflect the whole topical diversity of ANeT.

name: Austria World Space Forum-2019
author: United Nations
introduction_mn:
НҮБ-ын Гадаад сансрын асуудал эрхэлсэн газар / UNOOSA / хамтран зохион байгуулж буй UNISPACE + 50 зохион байгуулалттайгаар 2018 оныг олон улсын хамтын нийгэмлэгийн хувьд сэтгэл хөдөлгөм өдөр болгон тэмдэглэжээ. Энэхүү арга хэмжээнд Вена хотод дэлхийн өнцөг булан бүрээс ирсэн 800 гаруй оролцогчид, түүний дотор 30 гаруй сансрын агентлагийн төлөөлөл оролцов. UNISPACE + 50-ийн бодлогын гол үр дүн нь НҮБ-ын Ерөнхий Ассемблейн (A / RES / 73/91) баталсан Space2030 хөтөлбөрийг батлах тухай олон улсын хамтын нийгэмлэгийн хэлэлцээр байв. Space2030 хөтөлбөрт Тогтвортой хөгжлийн 2030 хөтөлбөр, Парисын хэлэлцээр, Гамшгийн эрсдэлийг бууруулах Сендай хүрээ зэрэг дэлхийн цаг үеийн зорилтод хүрэх сансрын үйл ажиллагаа, технологийн оруулсан хувь нэмрийг дахин батлах, бэхжүүлэх цогц стратеги гэж тусгасан болно.


НЭМЭЛТ
2019 оны 11-р сард нээлтээ хийсэн ДЭЛХИЙН ЗАМЫН ХЭЛЭЛЦҮҮЛЭГ бол НҮБ-аас зохион байгуулж буй шинэ арга хэмжээний цуврал бөгөөд 2016-2018 оны хооронд зохион байгуулагдсан 3 түвшний дээд хэмжээний форум дээр гаргасан зөвлөмж дээр үндэслэсэн болно. Форагийн дараалал нь нэмэгдэж буй хүмүүсийн сонирхол нэмэгдэж байгааг харуулж байна. сансрын эдийн засаг, сансрын нийгэм, сансрын хүртээмж, сансар судлалын тулгуур тулгуур ба олон улсын хамтын ажиллагааны ирээдүйн талаар хэлэлцэхэд оролцогчид оролцов. Урагшлахад Дэлхийн сансрын форум өндөр түвшний форумын байрыг эзлэх болно.

Нэгдсэн Үндэстний Байгууллага нь тогтвортой хөгжлийн нийтлэг зорилтыг хэрэгжүүлэхийн тулд шинэлэг шийдэл, технологийн шинэчлэлийг ашиглахыг зорьж байгаа бөгөөд энэ ажилд сансрын технологийн өвөрмөц боломжид анхаарлаа хандуулж байна. Иймээс UNISPACE + 50-ийн үр дүнг судалж, өнөөгийн солилцоо нь сансрын хайгуулын ажилд олон улсын хамтын ажиллагааны улс төр, эрх зүй, чадавхийг бэхжүүлэх элементүүдийг бүрэн эзэмших боломжийг бүрдүүлэхэд чухал ач холбогдолтой юм.

Бид ирээдүйгээ харж, сансрын тавцанд илүү олон оролцогчдыг угтан авч үзэхэд тогтвортой сансрын орчны олон улсын хамтын ажиллагаа нэн чухал юм. Нэгдсэн Үндэстний Байгууллага түншүүдтэйгээ хамт сансрын энергийг ашиглах чиглэлээр олон улсын үр бүтээлтэй, үр дүнтэй хамтын ажиллагааг өрнүүлэхэд бэлэн байна.

НҮБ-ын системд гаднах орон зайг энх тайвнаар ашиглах асуудлыг шийддэг цорын ганц алба бөгөөд UNOOSA нь холбогдох талуудыг харилцан нэгтгэж, өөрчлөлтийг хийж, сансрын ашиг тусыг хамгийн өргөн боломжтой байлгах онцгой нөхцөлтэй юм. хэрэглэгчийн суурь, дэлхийн бүх улс оронд.

Тиймээс НҮБ / Австри ДЭЛХИЙН ТӨЛӨВЛӨГӨӨНИЙ ФОРУМ нь дэлхийн хэмжээнд эдийн засаг, нийгмийн тогтвортой хөгжилд хүрэхийн тулд сансрын технологийг өөрсдийн боломжит хэмжээнд ашиглах зорилгоор "Space4All руу нэвтрэх" чиглэлд анхаарлаа хандуулж байна.
introduction_en:
The year 2018 was exciting for the international community, with the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA) hosting UNISPACE+50, which celebrated the 50 th anniversary of the United Nations Conference on Exploration and Peaceful Uses of Outer Space (UNISPACE). The event brought over 800 participants from all over the world together in Vienna, including representatives from over 30 space agencies. A key policy outcome of UNISPACE+50 was the international community's agreement, endorsed by the United Nations General Assembly (A/RES/73/91), to establish a Space2030 agenda. The Space2030 agenda is envisioned as a comprehensive strategy for reaffirming and strengthening the contribution of space activities and technologies to the achievement of global agendas such as the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, the Paris Agreement and the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction.


UNIQUENESS
Launched in November 2019, the WORLD SPACE FORUM is a new event series hosted by the United Nations that is built on the recommendations generated at three High-Level Fora held from 2016 to 2018.The sequence of Fora demonstrated the growing interest of an increasing number of actors in discussing the future of space and of international cooperation along the pillars of space economy, space society, space accessibility and space diplomacy. Going forward, the World Space Forum will take the place of the High Level Forum.

The United Nations aims to leverage innovative solutions and technological developments to realise common sustainable development goals, and attention is increasingly placed on the unique potential of space technologies in this endeavour. It is therefore important to build on the outcomes of UNISPACE+50 and take advantage of the momentum it generated to ensure that the current exchanges fully capture the political, legal and capacity building elements of international cooperation in space exploration.

As we look ahead to the future and welcome more actors to the space arena, international cooperation for a sustainable space environment is essential. Together with its partners, the United Nations stands ready to facilitate productive and impactful international cooperation in the peaceful uses of outer space.

As the only Office in the United Nations system that deals exclusively with the peaceful uses of outer space, UNOOSA is in a unique position to bring together all relevant stakeholders to make a difference and to ensure that the benefits of space are available to the broadest possible user base, in all countries around the world.

The United Nations / Austria WORLD SPACE FORUM therefore focuses on 'Access to Space4All', with the goal of leveraging space technologies to their full potential in order to achieve sustainable economic and social development globally.

introduction_en: After 16 years and Over 100 events, the Travel & Adventure Show Series has connected over 2.1 million travel enthusiasts with over 4,500 unique travel marketers in a professional setting that facilitates face-to-face conversations and has impacted over $4.9 billion in travel bookings. Each year, America’s most avid travelers flock to their favorite travel show to find, plan and book their dream vacation.

name: Asian Crystallographic Association
author: Asian Crystallographic Association
introduction_mn: We are anticipating more than 400 delegates from Asian countries. This will provide a platform for those working in these areas to present their most recent research findings and to exchange ideas in frontier research topics in crystallography. The meeting aims to organize a number of scientific sessions devoted to various research fields of crystallography, crystallographic workshops, flash presentations sessions for young researchers and a ‘Rising Star’ session featuring young scientists. The scientific scope of AsCA 2019 will cover all important aspects of crystallography-related areas, including crystal growth/crystallisation, synchrotron, neutron & electron diffraction, structural biology, bioinformatics, chemical crystallography, crystal engineering, materials and polymer science, pharmaceuticals, electron microscopy, and much more.

name: Газарзүйн тэнхимийн профессор багш нарын нэрэмжит ЭШ хурал
Solidarities and Challenges at the Intersection of Inequalities
author: International Association for Feminist Economics
introduction_en: The 2019 conference theme, Solidarities and Challenges at the Intersection of Inequalities, invites scholars, practitioners and activists engaged with the field of feminist economics to bring questions of ‘identity’ and ‘place’ into one of the most important debates in the current era: rising inequalities in income and wealth across the world. How are these debates deepened and broadened when they also take account of the interaction between marginalized and privileged social identities embedded in these inequalities? How do these intersections play out in relation to states, markets and community for different people and places across the world? And how can ideas and experiences that help forge solidarities across these differences contribute to ‘leaving no one behind’ in any future progress? The conference believes that feminist economics has a special contribution to make to an interdisciplinary scholarship on this challenging topic because of its ability to address economic questions through a range of different disciplines and methodologies.

name: МЕЖДУНАРОДНАЯ КОНФЕРЕНЦИЯ, ПОСВЯЩЕННОЙ 50-ЛЕТИЮ СРМКБЭ РАН И АНМ
author: ОХУ ШУА
introduction_mn: ОХУ-ын ШУА болон Монгол Улсын ШУА-ийн хамтарсан экспедицийн 50 жилийн ойд зориулсан эрдэм шинжилгээний хурал
introduction_en:
International conference dedicated to the 50th  anniversary of the Joint (Soviet-) Russian-Mongolian Complex Biological Expedition of RAS and MAS. The materials reflect both the achievements of the Russian and Mongolian employees of the Expedition for many years, and the results of the latest research. The topics of the reports are very wide: works of botanists, zoologists, soil scientists, geographers, geochemists, hydrobiologists,
nature conservationists and scientists of other specialties are presented here.

name: The international conference dedicated to the 50th anniversary of Joint Russian-Mongolian Complex Biological expedition RAS&MAS
author: Орос-Монголын хамтарсан Биологийн иж бүрэн экспедици
introduction_en:
MAIN TOPICS OF THE CONFERENCE
1. Flora, fauna, and ecosystem diversity
2. Phylogeny and systematics of organisms
3. The evolution of organisms and communities
4. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, and Palaeoecology
5. The transformation processes in the nature ecosystem
6. Ecological and biological basis for the ecosystems protection and restoration
7. New technologies, methods, and new approaches for solving environmental issues

name: 15th IFEAMA International Conference: “ Innovation Management for the Sustainable and Inclusive Development in a Transforming Asia”
author: International Federation of East Asian Management Association
introduction_mn: Азийн Менежментийн Холбоодын Олон Улсын Федераци (IFEAMA) нь Япон улсад төвтэй, Хятад, Монгол, Вьетнам, Орос, Солонгос, Тайвань зэрэг улс орнуудын бизнесийн удирдлагын чиглэлээр сургалт судалгаа явуулдаг өндөр ранктай их дээд сургуулиуд болон томоохон бизнес эрхлэгчдийн гишүүнчлэлтэй. Энэхүү байгууллага нь Азийн эрдэм шинжилгээ судалгааны байгууллагуудын хамтын ажиллагааг бэхжүүлэх зорилготойгоор үйл ажиллагаа явуулдаг.
introduction_en:
Purpose

This Federation aims to promote the research and the application of business administration in East Asia, and to contribute to industrial development in East Asia and the advancement of the management practice.

Business

To achieve the purpose of the former article, this Federation does the following business.

(a)Execution of research on management of East Asia and investigation and promotion

(b)Promotion of research and investigation project concerning management of East Asia

(c)Holding of regular conference, workshop, and lecture meeting and section meeting

(d)Offer and promotion of international medium to spread idea and knowledge of business administration with the issue of English journal, other publication and installation of website, etc.

(e)Unit of joining, friendship promotion of member, report with related scholarly associations , and cooperation.

(f)Additionally, execution of business necessary to achieve purpose.

name: Mongolia's participation in the Euro-Asian economic corridor
author: Монгол улсын ЗТХЯ, ГХЯ, Дэлхийн банк, МУИС-ийн Бизнесийн сургууль
introduction_mn: Монгол улс нь эдийн засгийн өсөлтөө дэмжсэн, ая тухай бөгөөд аюулгүй тээврийн үйлчилгээг бий болгоход чиглэсэн, нийгмийн хэрэгцээ шаардлагатайгаа уялдсан зам тээврийн салбарын урт хугацааны хөгжлийн бодлогоо тодорхойлсон улс. Энэхүү хурлын зорилго нь Монгол улс Евро-Азийн эдийн засгийн коридорт бүрэн хэмжээгээр нэгдэх, эдийн засгаа төрөлжүүлэн хөгжүүлэх нөхцөлд тулгарч болох институциональ болон  дэд бүтцийн сорилтуудыг шийдвэрлэхэд чиглэж байгаа юм.
introduction_en: Mongolia has determined its long term strategic policies that encourage economic growth and facilitate safe and comfortable travel and transport services, and are harmonious with the social demands. The objective of the current conference has been addressed institutional and infrastructure challenges that will be critical for Mongolia's full participation in the Euro-Asian economic corridor and economic diversification.

name: Globalization and Business development
introduction_mn: МУИС-ийн Бизнесийн сургуулийн Маркетинг, худалдааны тэнхим 60 жилийн ойн хүрээнд зохион байгуулсан бөгөөд дэмжигчээр Зам тээврийн Яам, Гадаад Хэргийн Яам, TRAM, Монгол Улсын Их Сургуулийн Бизнесийн сургууль, Өвөр Монголын Их Сургууль зэрэг байгууллагууд хамтран оролцов. "Бизнес ба Глобалчлал" олон улсын хурлын зорилго нь гадны томоохон сургуулиудын бизнесийн судалгаа шинжилгээний чиг хандлагатай танилцах, туршлага солилцох, хөрш орнуудын сургуулиудтай хамтарсан судалгаа явуулах, судалгаа шинжилгээ, инновацид суурилсан төсөл, хөтөлбөрүүдэд төр, хувийн хэвшил, эрдэмтэн судлаачдын оролцоо, түншлэл, хамтын ажиллагааг нэмэгдүүлэх, судлаачдын хамтын судалгааны үр дүнг нэгдсэн мэдээллийн санд нэгтгэх, сургалт, үйлдвэрлэлд нэвтрүүлэх, хурлын эмхэтгэлийг хэвлүүлж, олон нийтийн хүртээл болгоход чиглэсэн юм.
introduction_en: The conference was dedicated to the 60th anniversary of Marketing and Trade department of Business School and received significant contributions from various organizations and donors such as, Ministry of Road and Transport Development, Ministry of Foreign Relations, TRAM project, Business School of NUM and National University of Inner Mongolia. The aim of the conference was directed at exchanging views and experiences on the latest approaches and shifts in business analysis and research, conducting joint studies with the schools from neighbor countries, supporting PPP in R&D projects and programs, integrating results from joint studies into the shared data system and infusing it with manufacturing and education, and distributing printed booklets of the conference to the public.

name: Meeting of the Asian Network for Promoting Teacher Education on ESD
author: Formation of International Center of Excellence to Promote Teacher Education on ESD
introduction_mn:
Subsequently, the International Network of Teacher Education Institutions Associated with the UNESCO Chair on Reorienting Teacher Education to Address Sustainability, whose eighth international conference was hosted by the Okayama Regional Centre of Expertise on ESD in November 2014, seeks to spread ESD internationally, based on various national and regional results of ESD. Moreover, international cooperation in education pursues the implementation of ESD in developing counties, especially to promote teacher training on ESD. These requests have highlighted the future direction of international collaboration for the advancement of teacher education on ESD.
The purpose of this research is to collaboratively develop teacher training programs on ESD based on lesson study and to propose Asian standards, in coordination with core institutions on teacher education in East Asia (China, Korea, and Mongolia) and Southeast Asia (Indonesia, Laos, and Myanmar). Based on the development of the programs, it pursues to establish core institutions on ESD, to construct academic networks between these institutions, and to train future generations of researchers on ESD.
introduction_en: Education for Sustainable Development (ESD), in which UNESCO has taken the initiative since 2004, is now being undertaken in the Global Action Program (GAP) on ESD, with the purpose of spreading it worldwide. During this time, Okayama University has held the only UNITWIN/UNESCO chair program on ESD in Asian countries and participated in the Okayama Regional Centre of Expertise on ESD, authorized by the United Nations University. It has also energetically promoted teacher education on ESD, developing teacher training programs with a focus on prospective teachers as well as teachers in schools, in liaison with the Associated Schools Project University Network (ASPUnivNet) that is organized by 20 universities in Japan to support UNESCO associated schools. These results have led the Okayama ESD Project, in which Okayama University has taken the initiative, to be the first to receive a UNESCO/JAPAN ESD award within Japan in September 2016.

introduction_mn: “Хөдөө аж ахуйн тогтвтотой хөгжлийг хангахад залуу үеийн оролцоо”  эрдэм шинжилгээний бага хуралыг Хөдөө аж ахуйн их сургууль, Мал эмнэлгийн хүрээлэн хамтран зохион байгуулдаг. Энэхүү эрдэм шинжилгээний хурлын зорилго нь залуу эрдэм шинжилгээний ажилтнуудыг судалгааны ажилд мэргэшүүлэх, эрчимжүүлэх, судалгааны ажилд оролцох оролцоог нэмэгдүүлэх, хөдөө аж ахуйн хөгжлийн асуудлыг шийдвэрлэхэд залуу үеийн бүтээлч сэтгэлгээг хөгжүүлэх зорилготой юм. Энэхүү эрдэм шинжилгээний бага хурлыг 5 дахь жилдээ зохион байгуулж байгаа бөгөөд бүх эрдэм шинжилгээний бүтээл хураангуй байдлаар хэвлэгдэн гардаг. Эрдэм шинжилгээний бага хурлын судалгааны сэдэв нь амьтаны шинжлэх ухаан, үржүүлгийн шинжлэх ухааны хүрээнд явагддаг
introduction_en: The Research office of the Mongolian University of Life Sciences and Institute of Veterinary Medicine organize the joint scientific conference entitled “New generation towards agricultural sustainable development”. The aim of the this scientific and practical conference is intended to qualify and intensify the research study of young academic and research staff, to increase their participation in the research studies, and to develop creativeness of young generation to resolve issues on agricultural development. This scientific conference was conducted fifth years and all papers’ abstract publish in conference compilation. Research topics of scientific conference is Animal science, animal breeding.

name: VIENNA MONGOLIAN STUDIES SYMPOSIUM 2020: DISPERSED AND CONNECTED: MOBILITIES, MATERIATLITIES AND BELONGING(S) IN MONGOLIA AND BEYOND
author: Austrian Academy of Sciences
introduction_mn: he International Mongolian Studies Symposium Vienna will take place at the Weltmuseum Wien from January 23 rd to 24 th 2020. The symposium focuses on social and cultural anthropology and interdisciplinary approaches including Mongolia-related research on archaeology, history, arts and natural sciences. The symposium provides a forum for international Mongolian Studies scholars to present and discuss theoretical and empirical research, exchange knowledge and enhance networking and communication on current research issues and approaches. We intend to bring researchers, scholars and artists together biennially with the aim of discussing recent investigations, ongoing research projects and experiences.

introduction_en: Asian Research Institute for International Social Work (ARIISW), Shukutoku  University organises annually International Academic Symposium on Asian Buddhist Social Work. The symposium was held under the co-sponsorship of ARIISW Shukutoku University and Ryukoku University, in order to deepen understanding in the field of Buddhist Social Work.

name: Expert Group Meeting on New and Inclusive Multilateralism in North-East Asia
author: UNESCAP East and North-East Asia
introduction_en:
Expert Group Meeting on New and Inclusive Multilateralism in North-East Asia
4 Dec 2019 to 5 Dec 2019
Incheon, Republic of Korea
By invitation only

The Expert Group Meeting (EGM) on New and Inclusive Multilateralism in North-East Asia will be held on 4-5 December 2019 in Incheon, Republic of Korea. North-East Asian countries have substantially increased the level of economic integration, infrastructure connectivity, social interactions and bilateral and multilateral cooperation. However, there have been slow progress in institutionalizing multilateralism or regional integration. This situation hinders the subregion from fully utilizing potential complementarities in factor endowment and jointly addressing common challenges. Furthermore, recent developments in geopolitics have raised new questions on the roles and potentials of the existing functional cooperation and the direction of multilateralism in North-East Asia.

Launched in 2010, ESCAP East and North-East Asia Office (SOENEA) has built various platforms for subregional and multistakeholder cooperation among six North-East Asian countries, i.e. China, Democratic People’s Republic of Korea, Japan, Mongolia, Republic of Korea and the Russian Federation. In particular, ESCAP-SOENEA has strengthened and institutionalized subregional cooperation on connectivity (transport and energy), trade facilitation and environmental sustainability. This process has also brought diverse stakeholders together as drivers of multilateralism and supported the development of a new form of multilateral cooperation, i.e. inclusive multilateralism, highlighted by the UN Secretary General that has closer links with civil society and other stakeholders.

In this regard, the Meeting is to support the shared goals on and approaches to new and inclusive multilateralism in North-East Asia. To achieve this, the Meeting will:
1. Review the trend and status of multilateralism in North-East Asia;
2. Review the status of functional cooperation and integration mechanisms/arrangements in North-East Asia across economic, social, environmental and political areas;
3. Identify approaches to further strengthen and/or institutionalize functional cooperation arrangements towards an inclusive multilateral mechanism in North-East Asia; and
4. Provide guidance and feedback on the ESCAP study on a new and inclusive multilateralism in North-East Asia, to be presented at a subregional forum in May 2020.

name: World Finance Conference
author: World Finance Conference
introduction_en:
Following on from the highly successful inaugural SHARK TANK event at the World Finance Conference 2019 in Santiago, Professor Robert Faff from the University of Queensland Business School will co-ordinate and lead a new SHARK TANK event at the WFC2020 in Malta.

The key focus of this event:

-targeting HIGH QUALITY seasoned papers presented at the WFC2020 conference;

-papers to go through a fast-tracked review for publication at a participating journal;

-the reviews based on the SHARK TANK process (as described in the information sheet available at the link shown below).

 

Which journals are involved in the WFC2020 SHARK TANK event?


The currently signed-up journals are:


* Journal of International Financial Markets, Institutions & Money, Elsevier - Impact Factor 1.836

* Emerging Markets Review, Elsevier- Impact Factor 2.108

* Journal of Multinational Financial Management - Impact Factor 1.283

* Pacific-Basin Finance Journal, Elsevier - Impact Factor 1.442  

* Journal of Financial Stability, Elservier  - Impact Fcator 2.301

* International Review of Financial Analysis, Elsevier - Impact factor 1.694  

 

How do I initiate my nomination for the WFC2020 SHARK TANK event

Initial nomination is simple: at the time of your WFC2020 paper submission, you need to explicitly request that your paper be considered for the SHARK TANK event.  When you submit the paper please chose at same time the  Topic(s) of your paper and in the end of the topics you need will appears also? "Shark Tank". Please select also this option.  

 

What are all the steps and conditions involved in the WFC2020 SHARK TANK event?

Details of the series of steps and conditions are described in the guidelines and information sheet available at the following link:

 https://arc.eaa-online.org/sites/default/files/wfc2020_sharktankcall.pdf

 

Further Information & Enquiries

For updated SHARK TANK information consult Twitter: @FaffRobert searching #wfc2020sharktank

For any clarifications/queries regarding the SHARK TANK event, please email Professor Faff directly: r.faff@business.uq.edu.au

name: grand renewable energy
author: The Grand Renewable Energy 2018 Organizing Committee
introduction_en:
The Paris Agreement in COP21 is the agreement applicable to all participants of parties for the first time in history and serves as a turning point with an eye toward a decarbonized society. Under the Agreement, the greenhouse gas emissions are to be reduced dramatically to almost zero by the end of this century. With this long-term goal in the Paris Agreement, it is important for us to accelerate strategic efforts and initiatives carbon emission reduction in energy demand and supply.
The practical challenge to achieve is low- carbonization of energy supply, energy conversion, and energy conservation including smart integration of renewable energy in maximum both in supply and demand sides. Financial strategy, policy initiatives and advanced technology development must be associated with them. Intelligence and cutting edge technology are indispensable in the fields of electricity, electronics, mechanics, physics, chemicals, biology, architecture, civil, mathematics, meteorology, sociology, systems, finance, and integrated management.
We have great expectation and feel glad to have discussion about these crucial issues through the 900 papers’ presentation covering 12 areas of renewable energies. Plenary session by the invited speakers, more than 15 experts, from all over the world are also programmed. International exhibition is held in parallel.

name: Meeting of the Asian Network to Promote Teacher Education on Education for Sustainable Development
author: UNESCO Chair in Research and Education for Sustainable Development at Okayama University, Japan
introduction_mn: Энэхүү уулзалтын зорилго нь багшийн боловсролыг БОНХАЖ-тай нэгтгэх, багш нарт зориулсан сургалтын хөтөлбөр боловсруулах талаар ярилцах юм. Манай Азийн долоон орноос Хятад, Индонез, Япон, Лаос, Монгол, Мьянмар, Солонгос зэрэг орнуудын хамтарсан судалгааны төслийн гишүүд нь тогтвортой байдлыг хангах үүднээс Ази дахь багш нарын боловсролыг өөрчлөх чиглэлээр зөвлөмж, зөвлөмж боловсруулсан болно. Энэхүү уулзалт нь олон улсын хамтын ажиллагааг дэмжиж, судлаачдыг НҮБ-ын Тогтвортой хөгжлийн зорилтуудын (SDGs) 4.7 зорилтод хүрэх зорилгоор ТТБ-д судалгаа шинжилгээ хийхэд түлхэц болно гэж найдаж байна.
introduction_en:
The purpose of this meeting is to discuss the integration of teacher education with ESD and the development of training programmes for teachers. The members of our joint research project from Asian seven countries, China, Indonesia, Japan,
Lao PDR, Mongolia, Myanmar and Republic of Korea,have developed someguidelines and recommendations to reorient teacher education in Asia to address sustainability. It is hoped that the meeting will both encourage international cooperation and stimulate researchers to conduct research on ESD for achieving the target 4.7 of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

It is a tremendous and profound honor that we write this Foreword to the Book of abstracts
of the 2nd-ISST (International Seminar of Science and Technology) to be held in Tadulako
University, Palu, September 16 -17, 2020.
In this challenging year, we continue our tradition of assembling academics, researchers,
professionals, and students from Japan, Australia, Malaysia, and mostly Indonesia, who are
experts in science and technology.
The Conference substantially enliven the dynamic synergism of students and growing
academics and researchers with those who are more prominent in the form of virtual
presentation and discussion of new and latest work. The papers contributed to the recent
and sustainable development of integrated science and technology known in the field of
physics and applied physics, environmental and earth sciences, chemistry and physical
chemistry, material sciences, polymers, electronic devices, and mathematical and computer
sciences.
In association with the contributed papers, four keynote presentations will be virtually
delivered by Dr. Warwick Belzher from University of Newcastle, Australia, Professor
Koichiro Shiomori from University of Miyazaki, Japan, Professor Akrajas Ali Umar from
Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, and Professor Dahlang Tahir from Hasanuddin
University, Indonesia.
In addition, we would also like to show our gratitude to all committee members of the 2ndISST 2020 for their profound and enthusiastic cooperation in organizing such a great event.
This conference would not be accomplishable without participation from keynote speakers, 
2
presenters, reviewers, and all participants, particularly support from the Faculty of
Mathematics and Natural Sciences, Tadulako University.
We believe the proceedings following this conference will globally accommodate the
researcher with excellent references and be a catalyst to stimulate further research and study
in coverage areas.

name: “ХЭЛ, СОЁЛ, СОЁЛ ХООРОНДЫН ХАРИЛЦАА”  СЭДЭВТ ОЛОН УЛСЫН ЭРДЭМ ШИНЖИЛГЭЭНИЙ VII БАГА ХУРАЛ
author: Ховд их сургууль
introduction_mn:
Үндэслэл: Хэл бол хүн төрөлхтөний харилцааны хамгийн чухал хэрэглүүр, сэтгэхүйн
үндэс суурь юм. Шинжлэх ухаан яаж ч хөгжсөн хэлийг орлох харилцааны хүчирхэг
хэрэглүүр бий болохгүй нь ойлгомжтой. Тийм ч учраас хэлийг хүн төрөлхтөний түүх соѐл,
мэдлэг, туршлагыг нэг үеэс нөгөө үед өртөөлөн тээгч, оюун ухааны хүчирхэг хүлэг
онгоцтой зүйрлэдэг байна. Үндэстэн, угсаатан бүхэн өөр өөрийн өнгө төрх, мөн чанар,
агуулга бүхий хэл, соѐл, сэтгэлгээ, үнэт зүйлтэй. Бид бүхэн даяаршлын эрин үед олон
хэлийг ойлгон хүртсэнээр соѐл иргэншилийн ололт амжилтуудыг хүртэх, мэдрэх, түүнд
суралцах, түүнийг хэрэглэхийн зэрэгцээгээр өөрийн үндэстний өвөрмөц хэл, соѐл,
сэтгэлгээний онцлогийг танин мэдэх, түгээн дэлгэрүүлэх, судлан шинжлэх, үнэт зүйлсээ
хамгаалах, бахархах үзлээр тэжээгдэн байх нь оршихуйн нэгэн чухал үндэс болно.
Зорилго: Их Алтайн бүс нутгийн ард түмний хэл, соѐл, боловсрол, нийгмийн салбарын
судалгааг шинжлэх ухааны эргэлтэд оруулж, судлаач эрдэмтэд судалгааны ажлын үр
дүнгээ хэлэлцүүлэх, тэдний цаашдын судалгаа шинжилгээний ажлын уялдаа холбоог
сайжруулах, олон улсын төсөл, хөтөлбөрт оролцох, хамтран ажиллах санал солилцох
таатай нөхцөлийг бүрдүүлж, сургалт, судалгааны чиглэлээ өргөжүүлэх, эрдэм шинжилгээ,
судалгааны ажлаа хөгжүүлэх өргөн боломжийг бий болгоход чиглэгдэнэ.

name: “ХЭЛ, СОЁЛ, СОЁЛ ХООРОНДЫН ХАРИЛЦАА”  СЭДЭВТ ОЛОН УЛСЫН ЭРДЭМ ШИНЖИЛГЭЭНИЙ VII БАГА ХУРАЛ

Шинжлэх ухаан яаж ч хөгжсөн хэлийг орлох харилцааны хүчирхэг хэрэглүүр бий болохгүй нь ойлгомжтой. Тийм ч учраас хэлийг хүн төрөлхтөний түүх соѐл, мэдлэг, туршлагыг нэг үеэс нөгөө үед өртөөлөн тээгч, оюун ухааны хүчирхэг хүлэг онгоцтой зүйрлэдэг байна. Үндэстэн, угсаатан бүхэн өөр өөрийн өнгө төрх, мөн чанар, агуулга бүхий хэл, соѐл, сэтгэлгээ, үнэт зүйлтэй. Бид бүхэн даяаршлын эрин үед олон хэлийг ойлгон хүртсэнээр соѐл иргэншилийн ололт амжилтуудыг хүртэх, мэдрэх, түүнд суралцах, түүнийг хэрэглэхийн зэрэгцээгээр өөрийн үндэстний өвөрмөц хэл, соѐл, сэтгэлгээний онцлогийг танин мэдэх, түгээн дэлгэрүүлэх, судлан шинжлэх, үнэт зүйлсээ хамгаалах, бахархах үзлээр тэжээгдэн байх нь оршихуйн нэгэн чухал үндэс болно. Зорилго: Их Алтайн бүс нутгийн ард түмний хэл, соѐл, боловсрол, нийгмийн салбарын судалгааг шинжлэх ухааны эргэлтэд оруулж, судлаач эрдэмтэд судалгааны ажлын үр дүнгээ хэлэлцүүлэх, тэдний цаашдын судалгаа шинжилгээний ажлын уялдаа холбоог сайжруулах, олон улсын төсөл, хөтөлбөрт оролцох, хамтран ажиллах санал солилцох таатай нөхцөлийг бүрдүүлж, сургалт, судалгааны чиглэлээ өргөжүүлэх, эрдэм шинжилгээ, судалгааны ажлаа хөгжүүлэх өргөн боломжийг бий болгоход чиглэгдэнэ.

name: International Conference on Entrepreneurial Competencies in a Changing World
author: SHS Web of Conferences website
introduction_en:
SHS Web of Conferences is an Open Access publication series dedicated to archiving conference proceedings dealing with all areas of social sciences and humanities: sociology, economy, psychology, history, geography, linguistics, etc.

SHS Web of Conferences offers a wide range of services from the organization of the submission of conference proceedings to the worldwide dissemination of the conference papers. It provides an efficient archiving solution, ensuring maximum exposure and wide indexing of scientific conference proceedings.

SHS Web of Conferences publishes articles in French and English; papers in French must include English title and abstracts. Proceedings are published under the scientific responsibility of the conference editors.

name: Психология одаренности и творчества
author: Московский Городской Педагогический Университет
introduction_mn:
МОСКВА ХОТЫН БОЛОВСРОЛ, ШИНЖЛЭХ УХААНЫ ГАЗАР, "МОСКВА ХОТЫН ПЕДАГОГИК ИХ СУРГУУЛЬ", ОРОСЫН БОЛОВСРОЛЫН АКАДЕМИ,  ГЭР БҮЛИЙН ЭРҮҮЛ МЭНД, ХҮНИЙ НӨХӨН ҮЙЛ АЖИЛЛАГАА  ҮНДЭСНИЙ ТӨВ хамтран  2016 оноос хойш Web Of Conferences-той хамтран олон улсын онлайн бага хурлыг зохион байгуулж байна. Энэхүү бага хурал нь онтогенезийн янз бүрийн үе шатанд авьяаслаг хүмүүсийг тодорхойлох, дэмжих, хөгжүүлэх, сургах үндсэн ба хэрэглээний талуудын талаар ярилцахад авьяас чадвар, бүтээлч сэтгэлзүйн чиглэлээр ажилладаг Орос, гадаадын судлаачдыг татан оролцуулах зорилготой юм.
Чуулганы үеэр авьяас билэг, бүтээлч сэтгэлзүйн чиглэлээр мэргэшсэн тэргүүлэх мэргэжилтнүүдийн хийсэн эрдэм шинжилгээний ажлын үр дүнг илтгэл, секц, дугуй ширээний үеэр танилцуулах болно. Авьяаслаг байдал, бүтээлч байдлын арга зүйн асуудлууд, авьяас билгийн сэтгэлзүйн илрэлийн онол, эмпирик судалгааны концепцийн загвар, арга зүй, хүүхэд, насанд хүрэгчдийн бүтээлч чадвар, авьяас чадварыг хөгжүүлэх сэтгэлзүйн технологи, орчин үеийн нөхцөлд дэмжлэг үзүүлэх гэх мэт асуудлуудыг хэлэлцэхээр төлөвлөжээ.
introduction_en:
DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND SCIENCE OF THE CITY OF MOSCOW,  "MOSCOW CITY PEDAGOGICAL UNIVERSITY", Institute of Pedagogy and Psychology of Education
RUSSIAN ACADEMY OF EDUCATION ,  Science Center FAMILY HEALTH AND HUMAN REPRODUCTION PROBLEMS have been organizing an international online conferences jointly with the Web Of Conferences since 2016. The conference is aimed at attracting russian and foreign researchers in the field of psychology of giftedness and creativity to discuss the fundamental and applied aspects of identifying, supporting, developing and training gifted at different stages of ontogenesis.
During the conference, plenary reports, sections and round tables will be presented the results of scientific researches of leading experts in the field of psychology of giftedness and creativity. It is planned to discuss the methodological problems of giftedness and creativity, conceptual models and methods of theoretical and empirical research of psychological manifestations of giftedness, psychotechnology of the development of creative abilities and giftedness of children and adults, their support in modern conditions, etc.

name: Geo-Information for Disaster Management
author: IEEE Geoscinece and remote Sensing Society (IEEE-GRSS) International Association of Geodesy (IAG) International Cartographic Association (ICA) International Federation of Surveyors (FIG) International Geographic Union (IGU) International Map Industry Association (IMIA) International Society of Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing (ISPRS) – ISPRS ICWG III/IVa Disaster Assessment, Monitoring and Management (2016-2020)  Global Spatial Data Infrastructure (GSDI) Association International Hydrographic Organization (IHO) International Steering Committee for Global Mapping (ISCGM) Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) – Emergency& Disaster Management WG – Defense and Intelligence WG  United Nations Ofﬁce for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA) Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management (ISCRAM)
introduction_mn: тулгарч буй бэрхшээлийг хэлэлцэх, туршлагаа хуваалцах, шинэ санаагаа хэлэлцэх, технологийг харуулах, эрсдэл ба гамшгийн менежментийн үйл ажиллагааг илүү сайн дэмжих зэргээр хамтран ажиллах
introduction_en: Geo-information for Disaster management (Gi4DM) is an annual conference devoted to the use and application of geo-information technology in disaster management. The fundamental goal of the conference is to provide a forum where disaster managers, stakeholders, researchers, data providers and system developers can discuss challenges, share experience, discuss new ideas, demonstrate technology and analyse future research toward better support of risk and disaster management activities.

name: International Workshop on Advanced Image Technology
introduction_mn: Зургийн дэвшилтэт технологийн олон улсын семинар (IWAIT) нь дүрслэх технологийн дэвшилтэт чиглэлээр судлаач, профессор, оюутнууд, сонирхсон хүмүүсийг цуглуулдаг олон улсын нэр хүндтэй арга хэмжээ юм. Өмнөх IWAIT арга хэмжээнүүд 1998 оноос хойш Япон (2000,2003,2006,2013), Солонгос (1998, 2001, 2005, 2009), Тайвань (1999, 2002, 2008, 2015), Сингапур (2004, 2019), Тайланд (2007, 2014, 2018), Малайз (2010, 2017), Индонез (2011,2020) зэрэг Зүүн ба Зүүн Өмнөд Азийн орнуудад жил бүр зохиогдож ирсэн.
introduction_en: The International Workshop on Advanced Image Technology (IWAIT) is a well-known international event that gathers researchers, professors, students and interested persons in the field of advanced image technology. Previous IWAIT events have been held annually since 1998 in Eastern and South Eastern Asian countries such as Japan (2000,2003,2006,2013), Korea (1998, 2001, 2005, 2009), Taiwan (1999, 2002, 2008, 2015), Japan (2000, 2003, 2006, 2013), Singapore (2004, 2019), Thailand (2007, 2014, 2018), Malaysia (2010, 2017), Indonesia (2011,2020).

name: International Workshop on Advanced Image Technology (IWAIT) 2019

Өмнөх IWAIT арга хэмжээнүүд 1998 оноос хойш Япон (2000,2003,2006,2013), Солонгос (1998, 2001, 2005, 2009), Тайвань (1999, 2002, 2008, 2015), Сингапур (2004, 2019), Тайланд (2007, 2014, 2018), Малайз (2010, 2017), Индонез (2011,2020) зэрэг Зүүн ба Зүүн Өмнөд Азийн орнуудад жил бүр зохиогдож ирсэн.
introduction_en: The International Workshop on Advanced Image Technology (IWAIT) is a well-known international event that gathers researchers, professors, students and interested persons in the field of advanced image technology. name: Убсунурский междунарордный симпозиум
author: ГБУ РТ «Тувинский научный центр»
introduction_mn: Экосистемийн биосферийн функцийг хадгалан хамгаалах талаар олон шинэ санаа хөгжиж байгаа бөгөөд үүнд дэлхийн өргөргийн бүсчлэл, өндрийн бүсийн систем дэх био үйлдвэрлэл, хүрээлэн буй орчин, хөрс, биологийн олон янз байдлыг хамгаалах, генетик, биологийн нөөц орно. Ховор, ховордсон ан амьтдын амьдрах орчныг нөхөн сэргээх, хамгаалах тусгай хамгаалалттай газар нутгийн сүлжээг өргөтгөх талаар судалгааны ажлыг өрнүүлэх, хэтийн төлөвийг тодорхойлоход дэмжлэг үзүүлэх зорилготой. Хүрээлэн буй орчны боловсрол, шинжлэх ухаан, үйлдвэрлэлийн интеграцчилал, нийгэм, байгаль хоёрын харилцан хамаарлын асуудалд анхаарал хандуулахад чиглэгдэнэ.
introduction_en:
The ideas of preserving the biosphere functions of ecosystems are developing, including bio-production, environment-and soil-forming, biodiversity conservation, genetic and biological resources in the systems of latitudinal zoning and altitude zones of the Earth. Prospects for the development of the territorial system of protected areas for the restoration and protection of habitats of rare and endangered species and their populations are considered. It is focused on environmental education, integration of science, production, and the problem of the relationship between society and nature in different aspects.
For specialists in various fields of science, who are interested in searching for new ways of studying, preserving, and rational use of natural and anthropogenic landscapes, as well as for theorists and practitioners of wildlife conservation in its broad sense.

The purpose of the conference is to draw researchers' attention to the protection and development of children and youth, and to improve government policy and implementation in this regard.

name: Democracy, Power and Identity
author: IAPSS Asia
introduction_mn: 1998 оноос хойш IAPSS улс төр судлал, олон улсын харилцааны чиглэлээр оюутан, магистрант, докторантуудын дунд олон улсын эрдэм шинжилгээний хурлыг зохион байгуулж ирсэн. 2020 оны хурлыг МУИС-ийн Улстөр судлалын тэнхимтэй хамтран "Ардчилал, Хүч, Дүр төрх " сэдвийн доор зохион байуулсан.
introduction_en:
With a truly international audience with participants from all sub-disciplines of political science, international relations, and neighboring social sciences, the IAPSS Asia Academic Conference is a unique opportunity for individual academic learning, vivid debate, and networking.
Democracy, identity and power, concepts that behind the “veil of abstraction” enhanced by innumerable studies addressing them, are cornerstones for understanding contemporary politics and international relations.  However, in the past few liberal democracy has been gradually shattered by the thus termed “identity politics”. Moreover, the accentuating economic and social gap caused by globalization, the abuses of the “established elites”, among other phenomena, have fuelled even more the populist discourse, challenging the traditional understanding of democracy, its practice, and theory.
At the same time, identity is constructed according to the interests of power, which consequently propels itself by the cohesion of people’s collective identification. Today, due to the mercurial spreading of “identity politics”, the primacy of rules (based primarily on reason) as the prime source of authority is eroding, and observers witness the empowerment of Max Weber’s two alternative sources of rule: traditions (frequently, although not always directed against progress and development) and charisma (cantered around political leaders who may or may not feel bound by laws or traditions). But how can democracy survive in this complex and volatile scenario? If identity politics is polarising democratic societies to the point of no return, what is the way out? What are the consequences for governance of the shift from the primacy of rules to alternative sources of authority?

name: 41st Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society (EMBC)
author: IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society
introduction_en:
BIOMEDICAL ENGINEERING RANGING FROM WELLNESS TO INTENSIVE CARE

The IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society is pleased to announce the 41st International Engineering in Medicine and Biology Conference, to be held in Berlin, Germany from July 23–27, 2019. The overarching theme is “Biomedical engineering ranging from wellness to intensive care”. Consistent with our theme, we have arranged plenary keynotes from leading academic and industrial scientists, who will present aspects of innovation and translational engineering in biomedicine. The scientific tracks will cover the standard topics of the EMBS technical committees. Beside the scientific sessions, the congress exhibition will show biomedical companies, start-ups, biomedical institutes, universities, and provide networking opportunities for engineers, clinicians, other scientists, entrepreneurs and students.

name: SIRPA Forum-2020
introduction_mn:
‘SIRPA FORUM 2020’ эрдэм шинжилгээний хурал нь энэ удаад “КОВИД-19 ДЭЛХИЙН ШИНЭ ДЭГ ЖУРАМ” сэдвийн дор 2020 оны 12 дугаар сарын 05-ны өдөр цахимаар зохион байгуулагдлаа. 

Тус арга хэмжээнд үндэсний хэмжээний их сургуулиуд болон эрдэм шинжилгээний арав гаруй  байгууллагуудын нийт 50 гаруй судлаач нар судалгааны үр дүнгээ хэлэлцүүлэв. МУИС-ийн болон ОУХНУС-ын багш судлаачид мөн илтгэл хэлэлцүүллээ.     

‘SIRPA FORUM 2020’ эрдэм шинжилгээний хурал нь үндсэн сэдвийн хүрээнд – Гадаад бодлого, улс төр, аюулгүй байдал, нийгэм, эдийн засаг хүмүүнлэгийн харилцаа, нийтийн удирдлага, төрийн албаны хүний нөөцийн удирдлагын тулгамдсан асуудлууд – гэсэн дэд сэдвүүдийг хэлэлцсэн бөгөөд энэ нь хурлын ерөнхий сэдвийн агуулга ач холбогдолыг илэрхийлж байлаа.

‘SIRPA FORUM’ нь МУИС-ийн ОУХНУС-иас жил бүр зохион байгууллагддаг үндэсний хэмжээний эрдэм шинжилгээний хурал юм.
introduction_en: SIRPA Forum is annual academic conference in national level

name: International conference on Emerging Industry and Health Promotion (EIHP 2021)
author: National Chi Nan University of Taiwan
introduction_mn: We are organizing an international conference on Emerging Industry and Health Promotion (EIHP 2021), which will be held in Puli, Taiwan on July 2 – 4, 2021. This international conference aims at bringing together researchers and practitioners working across diverse fields relevant to the conference theme. The changing of industry innovative technology and business challenging competitiveness is overwhelming in the last decade. It is partly due to the emerging of new technologies such as IoT, I4.0, deep learning, self media, shared economy¸ and partly due to the international trade protection which constrains the development of global supply chain and regional tax-free agreement. The first theme of this conference focuses on the emerging industry which stems from the dynamic driving forces. Moreover, the advent of COVID-19 pandemic posed a tremendous setback on economy, but it also gives birth to new opportunities of emerging industry and health-related business, ranging from E-business, delivery platform, work-from-home appliances, facial mask design, disinfectant, food security, agricultural technology, and health promotion products. Successful entrepreneurs in this uncertain era mandatorily require high-quality human mind and performance enhancement which may be obtained from such training as aromatherapy, yoga, breathing and meditation. Practical experiences prove many benefits in human performance and health. The second theme of this conference builds its foundation on this sort of post pandemic economy and human performance training which will definitely play a major role in the future.

name: Achieving Sustained and Inclusive Growth in a Resource-rich, Landlocked Economy: Mongolia
author: asian development bank
introduction_en:
The Asian Development Bank (ADB) is organizing a webinar on 3 December 2020, Thursday from 2:00 p.m. to launch the book, Mongolia’s Economic Prospects: Resource-Rich and Landlocked Between Two Giants. This book presents an in-depth analysis of Mongolia’s economic opportunities and challenges, including the country’s wealth in natural resources as well as its unique geographical location, bordered by two of the world’s largest economies, the People’s Republic of China and the Russian Federation.   

We would like to invite you to join this webinar by registering in this link before the scheduled event. The Zoom link will be provided to registered participants. 

The webinar will focus on the Summary and Policy recommendations of the book and discuss ways of achieving sustained and equitable growth in Mongolia. 

ADB Chief Economist Mr. Yasuyuki Sawada and East Asia Department’s Director General James Lynch will give the welcome remarks. This will be followed by three presentations covering the main themes in the book and a panel discussion on the policy implications for Mongolia.

name: CONFERENCE OF THE ARABIAN JOURNAL OF GEOSCIENCES (CAJG)
author: Springer Nature
introduction_mn:
The Arabian Journal of Geosciences (AJG) is a Springer journal publishing original articles on the full range of Earth sciences in partnership with the Saudi Society for Geosciences. The journal focuses on, but is not limited to, research themes which have regional significance for the Middle East, the Euro-Mediterranean, Africa, Asia and some other regions of the world. The journal receives on average 4000 submissions a year and accepts around 1000 papers for publication in its 24 annual issues (acceptance rate around 25%). It benefits from the participation of an editorial team of 15 topical Chief Editors and 100 international Associate Editors who generously help in evaluating and selecting the best papers.
Celebrating  10 years of GeosciencesIn 2008, Prof. Abdullah Al-Amri, in close partnership with Springer, founded the Arabian Journal of Geosciences (AJGS). In 2018, the journal celebrated its 10th anniversary. To mark the event, the founder and Editor-in-Chief of the AJGS organized the 1st Conference of the Arabian Journal of Geosciences (CAJG) in close collaboration with Springer on 12–15 November 2018. The conference was an occasion to endorse the journal’s long-held reputation and brought together 450 authors from 70 countries, who work in the wide-ranging fields of Earth sciences. The dynamic four-day conference in a stimulating environment in Hammamet, Tunisia provided attendees with opportunities to share their latest unpublished findings and learn about the latest geosciences studies. The event also allowed attendees to meet and talk to the journal’s editors and reviewers. Three field trips were organized alongside the conference and many participants enjoyed the wonders of the geology of Tunisia.
 

In a continuation of the successful 1st CAJG, 2nd CAJG and 3rd CAJG, this year’s conference aims to bring geoscientists from all over the world to present and discuss their most recent findings. The 4th CAJG will continue to publish the newest findings in its proceedings and some special issues by Springer, with a clear mission to drive greater North-South (Europe-Africa) scientific cooperation and to open doors to new and enriching collaborations with geoscientists based in Asia and the Americas. Research studies from the wide-ranging fields of Earth sciences can be submitted for evaluation by the Conference Scientific Committee.

name: ГЕОГРАФИЧЕСКИЕ ИССЛЕДОВАНИЯ  СИБИРИ И АЛТАЕ-САЯНСКОГО  ТРАНСГРАНИЧНОГО РЕГИОНА
author: АЛТАЙСКИЙ ГОСУДАРСТВЕННЫЙ УНИВЕРСИТЕТ , Институт географии, г. Барнаул
introduction_mn:
В сборнике представлены материалы Международной научно-практической конференции «Географические исследования Сибири и Алтае-Саянского трансграничного региона», 
посвященной 35-летию со дня основания Института географии и 85-летию со дня рождения 
Виктора Семеновича Ревякина (26.03.1936-01.02.2020). Основные направления конференции: 
географическое образование в меняющемся мире; новые результаты физико-географических 
исследований региона; гляциологические исследования; проблемы территориального планирования, управления земельными ресурсами и организации хозяйственной деятельности; актуальные проблемы современного природопользования и сохранения природного наследия;
introduction_en:
The collection contains materials of the International Scientific and Practical Conference "Geographical Research of Siberia and the Altai-Sayan Transboundary Region", dedicated to the 35th anniversary of the founding of the Institute of Geography and the 85th anniversary of the birth
Viktor Semenovich Revyakin (03/26/1936 - 02/01/2020). 
The main directions of the conference:
geographic education in a changing world; new results of physical and geographical research of the region; glaciological research; problems of territorial planning, land management and organization of economic activities; actual problems of modern nature management and conservation of natural heritage;

name: IBS Scientific Workshop
author: IBS fund
introduction_mn: Олон улсын ЭШ-ний хурал
introduction_en:
This volume of IBS Scientifi c Workshop Proceedings collects research work from
international cooperation between German, Mongolian and Russian universities. The
research work was presented at the annual IBS International Summer School organized
2015 from 29th June to 1th July in Laubusch, Germany. Also students from India and
Turkey joined the summer school with their research approaches.
This reading on hand contains a selection of papers presented in 2015. Key topics
are E-learning from different points of view, the development of special hardware for
medical uses and mobile network planning and developing in Mongolia.
One of the main goals of this international event is to give opportunity to students and
researchers of partner universities to work together during school time actively and
freely in frame of science and international cooperation.
Foundation IBS thanks Prof. Dr. habil. Uranchimeg Tudevdagva, Prof. Dr. Evgeny Tsoy
and Prof. Dr. Wolfram Hardt for their entire support of IBS International Summer School.

name: International Workshop on State of the Art in Nuclear Cluster Physics
author: American Institute of Physics (AIP) Publishing LLC
introduction_mn: About the conference: The 4th international workshop on “State of the Art in Nuclear Cluster Physics,” (SOTANCP) is held at the Galvez Hotel in Galveston Texas, USA, during May 13-18, 2018. This is the fourth workshop in the series that started in Strasbourg in 2008 and continued in Brussels in 2010 and then in Yokohama in 2014.
introduction_en: Today, AIP Conference Proceedings contain over 100,000 articles published in 1700+ proceedings and is growing by 100 volumes every year. This substantial body of scientific literature is testament to our 40-year history as a world-class publishing partner, recognized internationally and trusted by conference organizers worldwide. Whether you are planning a small specialist workshop or organizing the largest international conference, contact us, or read these testimonials, to find out why so many organizers publish with AIP Conference Proceedings.

name: Asia Pacific Physics Conference (APPC12)
author: Asia-Europe Physics Summit
introduction_en: This book of proceedings collects the papers presented at the 12th Asia Pacific Physics Conference (APPC12) held at the International Conference Hall in Makuhari, Chiba, Japan, from 14th to 19th July 2013. The conference APPC, one of the major activities of Association of Asia Pacific Physical Societies (AAPPS), has been held every two or three years since its first meeting at Singapore in 1983. ASEPS (Asia-Europe Physics Summit) is another AAPPS activity organized in collaboration with EPS (the European Physical Society). The third ASEPS meeting was held together with APPC12 during its period.

name: International Symposium Quasifission Process in Heavy Ion Reactions
author: Institute of Physics (IOP)
introduction_en: The aim of this Symposium is to wide and detail discuss of problems arising in front of experimental and theoretical groups and to find overlap between different approaches and methods which are devoted to study the same physical object-nuclear reaction dynamics.  The  Proceedings  of  the  talks  presented  at  Symposium will  be  available  in  the  form  of “online-only publication”.

name: International Symposium on Origin of Matter and Evolution of Galaxies
author: EPJ Web of Conferences
introduction_en: We are pleased to announce that the International Symposium on Origin of Matter and Evolution of Galaxies (OMEG 2017) will take place at Hotel ICC in Daejeon, Korea, June 27-30, 2017. This symposium is the 14th symposium of the series, started in 1988, on nuclear astrophysics and related fields. OMEG 2017 will provide a melting furnace of physics, astrophysics, astronomy, cosmology, and related fields to enhance our understanding of origin of matter and evolution of universe. Topics to be covered include • Big Bang Cosmology and Primordial Nucleosynthesis • First Generation Stars and Galactic Chemical Evolution • Astronomical Observations with Light, X-Ray, Gamma-Ray, and Cosmic-Ray • Stellar Evolutions and Hydrostatic Burning Processes • Experimental Nuclear Physics for Astrophysics • Theoretical Nuclear Physics for Astrophysics • Explosive Stellar Objects and Nuclear Physics • Meteorite Analysis and Isotopic Abundance • Nuclear Matter and Neutron Stars • Nuclear Data for Astrophysics and Related Topics • Underground Nuclear Astrophysics • Next generation RI Beam Facilities for Nuclear Astrophysics

Энэ конференц нь бионөөц, энерги, хүрээлэн буй орчин болон материалын технологийн салбарын шинэ судалгааны үйл ажиллагааг дэмжих, сэргээхэд тусгайлан зориулагдсан тул хуралд оролцон өөрийнхөө судалгааг хэлэлцүүлж, нэр нөлөө бүхий эрдэмтэн судлаачидтай идэвхитэй хэлэлцүүлэг өрнүүлэн, хамтран ажиллах боломжтой.
introduction_en: The 4th International Conference on Bioresources, Energy, Environment, and Materials Technology (BEEM 2020) will be held at the Songdo Convensia on September 6-9 in Incheon, Korea. This conference was specifically designed to stimulate new research activities in the technological fields of bioresources, energy, environment, and materials. We encourage you to participate in the progress of the shares of research with eminent researchers through active discussion collaboration.

name: 2020 International Virtual Forum on Greening and  Land Degradation Neutrality in Dryland
author: Asian Forest Cooperation Organization
introduction_mn:
Энэхүү чуулганы зорилго нь:
би. Мэргэжилтнүүдийн амжилттай тохиолдсон тохиолдлууд, бэрхшээлүүд / сургамжийг хуваалцах, газрын доройтолтой тэмцэх, орон нутгийн амьжиргааг сайжруулах чиглэлээр хамтарсан төсөл боловсруулах;
II. Ой, ландшафтыг нөхөн сэргээх, газрын доройтлыг саармагжуулах үр дүнтэй, оновчтой стратегийн талаар хэлэлцэх; болон
iii. Ландшафтыг нөхөн сэргээх, газрын доройтлыг саармагжуулах чиглэлээр эрдэм шинжилгээний хүрээлэн, их дээд сургууль, төрийн бус байгууллагын дунд сүлжээг хөгжүүлэх.
IV. Олон улсын хуурай газрын ногоон байгууламжийн сүлжээг хөгжүүлэх, 2021 онд Солонгос улсын Сөүл хотод болох Дэлхийн ойн аж ахуйн 15-р их хуралд санаачилга гаргах.
introduction_en:
The objectives of this program are:
i.	To share the successful cases and challenges/lessons learned by experts and develop cooperative project on combating land degradation and improving local livelihood;
ii.	To discuss the effective and efficient strategies for forest and landscape restoration and land degradation neutrality ; and
iii.	To develop the network among research institutes, universities and non-government organization on landscape restoration and land degradation neutrality.
iv.	To develop the International Drylands Greening Network and prepare an initiative in the 15th World Forestry Congress in Seoul, Korea in 2021.

name: 40th Asian Conference on Remote Sensing (ACRS 2019)

introduction_mn:
AARS-ийн дүрмийн 4-р зүйлд заасны дагуу
"Холбооны үндсэн үйл ажиллагаа нь Алсын зайнаас тандан судлах Азийн бага хурлыг (ACRS) зохион байгуулах явдал юм. Холбоо нь мөн зорилгодоо нийцүүлэн алсын зайн тандан судлах бусад үйл ажиллагааг явуулж болно.
AARS-ийн дүрмийн 8-р зүйлд заасны дагуу
"ACRS-ийг Ерөнхий бага хурлаар баталсан онцгой тохиолдлоос бусад тохиолдолд жил бүр 10-р сараас 12-р саруудад зохион байгуулна."
ACRS-ийг зохион байгуулагч орнууд нь:
Тайланд (1980), Хятад (1981), Бангладеш (1982), Шри Ланка (1983), Непал (1984), Энэтхэг (1985), Солонгос (1986), Индонез (1987), Тайланд (1988), Малайз (1989) , Хятад (1990), Сингапур (1991), Монгол (1992), Иран (1993), Энэтхэг (1994), Тайланд (1995), Шри Ланка (1996), Малайз (1997), Филиппин (1998), Хонконг ( 1999)
introduction_en:
"The principal activity of the Association shall be to hold the Asian Conference on Remote Sensing (ACRS). The Association may also conduct other remote sensing activities consistent with its aims.
According to the Article 8 of the statutes of the AARS,
"ACRS shall be held each year within the period from October to December except a special case which is approved by the General Conference."
The host countries of the ACRS are:
Thailand(1980), China(1981), Bangladesh(1982), Sri Lanka(1983), Nepal(1984), India(1985), Korea(1986), Indonesia(1987), Thailand(1988), Malaysia(1989), China(1990), Singapore(1991), Mongolia(1992), Iran(1993), India(1994), Thailand(1995), Sri Lanka(1996), Malaysia(1997), Philippines(1998), Hong Kong(1999)

introduction_en: The aim of the Congress is to undertake interdisciplinary and international comparisons of studies, viewpoints and discussions of the two main subject matters “Politics” and “Woman” by scientists and researchers who will participate from various different locations of Turkey and the world. During this International Congress the place and significance of women within the spheres of family, law, science, art, politics, culture and socio-economy throughout the ages will be assessed in context of interdisciplinary studies involving women in throughout Turkey and the world.

name: Annual Conference of the European Association of Environmental and Resource Economists
author: The European Association of Environmental and Resource Economists
introduction_en:
EAERE 2020 Goes Virtual
It is our pleasure to host the 25th Annual Conference of the European Association of Environmental and Resource Economists online in 2020! Due to the corona virus outbreak the city government of Berlin has decided that all physical events at universities have to be cancelled until the end of July. Therefore EAERE together with the PC and LOC decided to hold this year's conference as a virtual event.

The conference is organized by Technische Universität Berlin and Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin (HU Berlin). The conference is supported by the wider Berlin research community in environmental and resource economics, most notably by the German Institute for Economic Research (DIW Berlin), and Mercator Research Institute on Global Commons and Climate Change (MCC). The organization of the conference is also supported by the Berlin Chamber of Commerce and Industry (CCI).

We are looking forward to virtually welcoming you to the conference - save the date!

Tuesday, June 23 - Friday, July 3, 2020

name: XXIV ISPRS Congress 2022-Nice, France
author: International Society of Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing
introduction_en:
The International Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing is a non-governmental organization devoted to the development of international cooperation for the advancement of photogrammetry and remote sensing and their applications. The Society operates without any discrimination on grounds of race, religion, nationality, or political philosophy. 
Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing is the art, science, and technology of obtaining reliable information from noncontact imaging and other sensor systems about the Earth and its environment, and other physical objects and processes through recording, measuring, analyzing and representation.
Learn more… http://www.isprs.org/

The scientific and technical work of the ISPRS is accomplished by 5 Technical Commissions. Every commission is composed of several working groups (WG) and intercommission working groups (ICWG)

name: International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium
author: The IEEE Geoscience And Remote Sensing Symposium is the most important meeting for the membership of the IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Society (GRSS
introduction_mn:
GRSS-ийн гишүүд нь янз бүрийн шинжлэх ухаан, инженерчлэлээс гаралтай. Инженерийн боловсролтой гишүүд техник хангамж, өгөгдөл боловсруулах техник технологийг боловсруулж, хөгжүүлэхэд чиглэсэн шинжлэх ухааны судалгааг ихэвчлэн дэмжиж, геофизик, геологи, гидрологи, цаг уур гэх мэт гео шинжлэх ухааны мэдлэгтэй байхыг шаарддаг. зайнаас тандан судлахтай холбоотой шинжлэх ухааныг түгээх. Гео шинжлэх ухаан ба инженерийн салбаруудын энэхүү уялдаа холбоо нь GRSS-д салбар дундын өвөрмөц шинж чанарыг өгч, зайнаас тандан судлах шинжлэх ухаан, технологийг хөгжүүлэхэд сэтгэл хөдөлгөм үүрэг гүйцэтгэдэг.
IGARSS-ийн үеэр GRSS-ийн гишүүд болон гишүүн бус хүмүүс газарзүйн шинжлэх ухаан, зайнаас тандан судлах чиглэлээр хийсэн хамгийн сүүлийн үр дүн, шинэлэг төслүүдээ хуваалцаж байна. IGARSS бол томоохон чуулган бөгөөд GRSS нийгэмлэгийг бүрдүүлдэг бүх техникийн нийгэмлэгүүд янз бүрийн хуралдаан, уулзалт, техникийн үйл ажиллагаанд цуглардаг. Та бүхэн тус чуулганаас өөрийн судалгаанд шууд хамааралтай сэдвүүдийг олох болно гэдэгт би итгэлтэй байна. Гэсэн хэдий ч IGARSS-ийн олон янзын техникийн хөтөлбөр нь бидний сонирхсон хүрээнд үйл ажиллагаа явуулдаг боловч уламжлалт байдлаар бид холбоогүй бусад нийгэмлэгүүдийг татан оролцуулах газар юм. Олон талт байдал нь давуу тал бөгөөд өөр өөр үзэл бодол, үзэл бодлын хөндлөн бордолт нь үргэлж шинэ санаа, шинэ судалгааны төслүүдийг авчирсаар ирсэн.
introduction_en:
Members of GRSS come from a wide variety of scientific and engineering backgrounds. Members with engineering backgrounds often support scientific investigations with the design and development of hardware and data processing techniques, requiring them to be familiar with geosciences such as geophysics, geology, hydrology, meteorology, etc. Conversely, scientists find in GRSS a forum for the evaluation and dissemination of remote sensing related science. This fusion of geoscience and engineering disciplines gives GRSS an unique interdisciplinary character and an exciting role in advancing remote sensing science and technology.
During IGARSS, GRSS members and non-members share their latest results and novel developments in the area of geoscience and remote sensing. IGARSS is a big conference, and all the technical communities that form the GRSS community are gathering in different sessions, meetings and technical activities. I am sure each of you will find in this conference topics that are directly important to your own research. However, the diverse technical program of IGARSS is also a place to engage other communities, who operate within our own field of interest but with whom traditionally we do not connect. Diversity is an advantage, and cross-fertilization of different ideas and points of view has always brought to new ideas and new research projects.

introduction_mn: Боловсролын тулгамдсан асуудал шийдэл арга зам хурлыг МУИС, МУБИС, БМДИ, БҮТ, Боловсролын хүрээлэн гэсэн 5 байгууллага хамтран зохион байгуулдаг. Энэ удаад МУИС гол зохион байгуулагчаар ажилласан ба анх удаа хянан магадлагаа хийж, 2021.02.26-27-д онлайнаар зохион байгуулсан.
introduction_en: This conference jointly organized by Mongolian Educational University, National University of Mongolia, Institute of Teacher Professional Development , Educational Assessment Center on 25-26 February, 2021. It's the seventh national conference to be focused on the educational study.

name: Эмэгтэйчүүд-Судалгаа шинжилгээний ажилд
author: WSTEM Mongolia
introduction_mn: Монголынэмэгтэй инженерүүд, технологичид, эрдэмтэд, математикчдын нэгдсэн байгууллага /МЭИТЭМ/ нь эмэгтэй эрдэмтэд, инженерүүдийнхамтын үйл ажиллагааг бүх талаар дэмжин улс орны хөгжил, инженерийн бүтээн байгуулалт, шинжлэх ухаанд тодорхой хувь нэмэр оруулах зорилготой үүсгэн байгуулагдсан, гишүүддээ үйлчлэх сайн дурын, ашгийн бус бөгөөд Дэлхийн (INWES) болон  Ази номхон далайн  бүсийн  орнуудын эмэгтэй инженерүүд, эрдэмтдийн нэгдсэн байгууллага (APNN)-ын гишүүн байгууллага юм. МЭИТЭМ нь 2012 онд үүсгэн байгуулагдсан ба жил бүр зохион байгуулагддаг Ази номхон далайн  бүсийн  орнуудын эмэгтэй инженерүүд, эрдэмтдийн уулзалт-хурал, гурван жил тутам зохион байгуулагддаг дэлхийн эмэгтэй инженерүүд, эрдэмтдийн хуралд Монгол орны эмэгтэйчүүдийг төлөөлөн оролцож ирсэн ба одоогоор удирдах зөвлөлийн 17 гишүүн, 350 гаруй идэвхтэй гишүүдтэйгээр үйл ажиллагаа явуулж байна.
introduction_en:
The Association was formed after a Mongolian women scientist attended the 15th International Conference of Women Engineers and Scientists (ICWES15) in Adelaide, Australia July 19-22, 2011. WSTEM in Mongolia exists to foster Mongolia’s economic development, based on the latest scientific knowledge, and in so doing, build a better future for Mongolian women scientists and girls. The organization aims to  pass along the knowledge and activities of women scientists to young researchers; to introduce women scientists’ creativity to international and domestic audiences; and to protect the interests of Mongolian women scientists.
Our philosophy is that the key to developing Mongolia is to support the education and innovation of women in STEM fields; and to create and support career paths for Mongolian women and girls culminating in leadership roles in science and technology, now and in the future.

author: Mongolian University of Life Sciences
introduction_mn: The aim of this conference is intended to meet the challenges, agricultural ecosystems need to be reconfigured worldwide towards great resilience and sustainability.
introduction_en: The aim of this conference is intended to meet the challenges, agricultural ecosystems need to be reconfigured worldwide towards great resilience and sustainability.

introduction_mn: Багш, судлаач, эрдэмтэд шинжилгээ судалгааны ажлын үр дүнгээ танилцуулах, судалгаа шинжилгээний ажил хийх идэвхийг нэмэгдүүлж тогтмолжуулах, докторантурын судалгааны ажлыг эрчимжүүлэх, хэлэлцүүлэх, туршлага солилцох зорилготой.
